0.title: Hilarious: Ashneer reacts to YouTuber Ashish's 'sasta' Shark Tank acting
0.article_body: Shark Tank India's judge, BharatPe co-founder Ashneer Grover reacted to a video of the show's spoof by YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani. Taking to Instagram, Ashish shared a teaser of the show, where the entrepreneurs are seen pitching their ideas and the 'sharks' reacting to them. He captioned the post, "Entries...open for Sasta Shaark Tank." Reacting to the post, Ashneer wrote, "Hilarious!"

1.title: Mumbai Coastal Road project to be completed by Nov 2023: BMC
1.article_body: The Mumbai Coastal Road project will be completed as per the decided deadline of November 2023, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) said on Saturday. Once the construction of the 10.58 km long road is complete, another 8.5 km long and 20-metre wide sea promenade between the Priyadarshini Park and the Worli side of the sea link will be added.

2.title: It will take you several generations to recover: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy to Russia
2.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Saturday said in a video address, "I want everyone to hear me now, especially in Moscow. The time has come for a meeting, it's time to talk." He added, "The time has come to restore territorial integrity and justice for Ukraine. Otherwise, Russia's losses will be such, it will take you several generations to recover."

3.title: 1 killed, 53 hurt as 2 communities clash over rash driving in MP
3.article_body: A 25-year-old man was killed and about 53 others injured after Muslim and tribal communities clashed in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen, police said. Some locals had reportedly reproached a bike rider for driving rashly, following which he returned with a few others and beat them, a police official said. Later, tribals gheraoed shops belonging to Muslims, another police official said.

4.title: Director said 'Just copy what I do', reduced level of actor to monkey: Tisca
4.article_body: Actress Tisca Chopra said that a director once told her to "just copy" what he did. "He basically reduced the level of a trained actor to that of being a monkey. I don't see him working actively right now, but at that time, I was young, and it was hard to deal with that sort of condescension," she added.

5.title: Sweeper locks Chandigarh hospital's private ward, naps inside; suspended
5.article_body: A sweeper was suspended after he was found napping inside a private ward of a hospital in Chandigarh. Reports said that the door of the private ward was locked from inside and the sweeper opened it after some knocking. "The sweeper has been suspended and the outsourced agency has been asked to substitute him," UT Health Secretary Yashpal Garg said.

6.title: I was like who do I call when I've panic attack: Shawn post-breakup with Camila
6.article_body: Speaking about his breakup with his ex-girlfriend, Camila Cabello, singer Shawn Mendes said, "You don't realize when you're breaking up with someone [and] all the s*** that comes after it. Which is like, who do I call when I'm...in a panic attack." Shawn further said that he's on his own now. "I hate that...[but] that's my reality," he said.

7.title: Pastor killed by Maoists in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur: Police
7.article_body: Maoists allegedly killed a pastor on suspicion of being a police informer, in Bastar’s Bijapur district, Chhattisgarh, police said on Saturday. The police stated that a Maoist pamphlet was recovered from the spot. The deceased was dragged out of his house and attacked with sharp-edged weapons by the Maoists, Inspector General of Police, Bastar range, Sundarraj P, said.

8.title: JNU scholars move Delhi HC as admin changes their PhD supervisor
8.article_body: Two JNU research scholars moved Delhi High Court after the administration issued an order to change their PhD supervisor midstream. The University said that the decision was taken as the guide would superannuate in less than three years. The petitioners, fourth-year MPhil-PhD students, argued that adding a new person as supervisor could hamper their ability to complete research.

9.title: Ferrari's Leclerc beats Red Bull's Verstappen, gets pole at Bahrain GP
9.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc beat Red Bull's Max Verstappen to claim pole position in the first qualifying session of the 2022 Formula One season at the Bahrain Grand Prix. Leclerc finished with a time of 1:30:558. Leclerc's teammate at Ferrari Carlos Sainz finished in third place while Verstappen's teammate at Red Bull Sergio Perez finished in fourth place.

10.title: Bengal BJP MP claims bomb hurled at his car after watching 'The Kashmir Files'
10.article_body: Jagannath Sarkar, BJP MP from West Bengal's Ranaghat, has alleged that a bomb was hurled at his car while he was returning after watching the film 'The Kashmir Files'. "We escaped the bomb narrowly. No one is secure in Bengal...Democracy has been toppled by the state government," he said. Sarkar added that President's rule should be imposed in the state.

11.title: 2 groups clash after objection over playing DJ music near mosque in UP
11.article_body: Six people were arrested after members of two communities pelted stones at each other after getting into argument over playing of DJ music during Holi in Amroha district. Police said group was playing DJ music in empty plot next to mosque in Kotwali area, following which a group of people objected to music being played. The argument soon turned violent.

12.title: Heavy vehicles barred from entering Faridabad during day till April 4
12.article_body: Heavy vehicles will be barred from entering Faridabad during the day from March 19 to April 4 to avoid congestion during Surajkund International Crafts Mela. "Thousands of commuters travel to attend the Surajkund mela due to which there is heavy congestion...Heavy vehicles can only enter Faridabad between midnight and 7 am till April 4," said an official.

13.title: 3 parking employees held for extortion in Chandigarh's Sector-26 grain market
13.article_body: The Chandigarh Police, while acting on the directions of the Punjab and Haryana HC, arrested a parking manager and his two staffers for charging entry fees at the Sector 26 grain market. The HC bench had directed police to register a criminal case against the market's parking contractor if his staff is found charging a parking fee.

14.title: Ukrainian Foreign Minister shares pic of ruins of theatre bombed by Russia
14.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba took to Twitter to share a picture of ruins of the drama theatre in Mariupol bombed by Russia. "Inhuman Russian war crime. I want to ask multinational companies still working with or in Russia: how can you keep doing business with them? How can you feed, serve, and pay those who did this?" he wrote.

15.title: Ghaziabad aims to vaccinate 1.44 lakh in 12-15 age group in 15 days
15.article_body: After being given a target by the state health department to vaccinate 1,44,000 children in the 12-15 age group, Ghaziabad district health department officials said that they aim to achieve the target within a fortnight. According to Additional Chief Medical Officer Dr Sunil Tyagi, 15 centres in the district have a "given supply of Corbevax vaccines".

16.title: ASI killed, 10 injured after mob sets Bihar police station on fire
16.article_body: An assistant sub-inspector (ASI) was killed and 10 others were injured after a mob allegedly set fire to a police station over a custodial death in Bihar's Bettiah on Saturday. The police fired 15 rounds and resorted to lathi-charge to stop the mob. Earlier, a man who was reportedly playing orchestra during Holi celebrations had died in police custody.

17.title: Video of death threat against K'taka HC Chief Justice surfaces after hijab judgement
17.article_body: Police have registered a case and booked three persons in Tamil Nadu over a video of a person threatening to kill Karnataka High Court Chief Justice Ritu Raj Awasthi and others. It comes days after the judgement of the court upholding the ban on hijab in educational institutions. The three accused are functionaries of the Tamil Nadu Thowheed Jamath (TNTJ).

18.title: My husband gets very affected: Sunny on trolls attacking their parenting
18.article_body: Actress Sunny Leone said her husband Daniel Webber gets very affected when anything is said about their children, especially Nisha, who they adopted and when trolls attack their parenting. "I don't read [such comments on social media]. Daniel, on the other hand, reads everything...It hurts his feelings," Sunny added. "He's extremely sensitive about children, especially Nisha," she said.

19.title: India's daily COVID-19 cases fall below 2,000, active cases at 26,240
19.article_body: India has reported 1,761 new COVID-19 cases and 127 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 127 deaths, 21 deaths occurred during the day in the country, while 106 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,16,479, and the active cases declined to 26,240.

20.title: Woman said father's body was chopped into 50 pieces: Pallavi on 'The Kashmir..'
20.article_body: Actress Pallavi Joshi, while talking about interviews for 'The Kashmir Files', said that a woman said her father was shot dead and that his body was chopped into fifty pieces and stuffed into a sack. "When the sack surfaced after 2-3 days, they identified the body with a piece of ID card on the body," Pallavi recalled woman saying.

21.title: At least 40 benefitted from accident insurance scheme since April 2020: PMC
21.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has said that at least 40 property taxpayers have received compensation worth ₹1.63 crore under its Pandit Deendayal Upadhyay accident insurance scheme since April 2020. Under the scheme, if the spouse of a taxpayer dies in an accident, the family gets ₹5 lakh, while in case of death of a child, it gets ₹2.5 lakh.

22.title: Word 'pan-India' irks me, I don't think anyone says pan-America: Dulquer
22.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan talked about the term 'pan-India film', which has been used for films like 'Baahubali', 'Pushpa: The Rise', and the upcoming 'RRR'. "The word pan-India really irks me. I just don't like hearing it," he said, adding, "I love that there's so much exchange of talent happening in cinema...but we're one country. I don't think anyone says pan-America."

23.title: Not looking way ahead, not looking at IPL 2022 as comeback: Hardik Pandya
23.article_body: GT captain Hardik Pandya, who last featured for India in the 2021 T20 World Cup, has said he's not looking at IPL 2022 as his comeback. "I just want to be in a positive mindset and [not look] way ahead...If I do things right, then things will fall into place," he stated. Titans will play against LSG on March 28.

24.title: We're going to play real hard and tough cricket this season: PBKS' Mayank
24.article_body: Mayank Agarwal, who'll lead PBKS for the first time as full-time captain this IPL season, has said they're going to play real hard and tough cricket. "It's going to be a high-intensity tournament, and while we are on the field, we mean business, pure business," he added. PBKS will begin their campaign against RCB on March 27.

25.title: Told Pallavi our lives will be at risk: Vivek Agnihotri on 'The Kashmir Files'
25.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri, while talking about 'The Kashmir Files', said he told wife and actress Pallavi Joshi their lives would be at risk and that the path is filled with thorns. "I told Pallavi...our credibility will...be discredited...biggest issue I had was...if we fail in this, no one will...attempt to make film on this topic for next 100 years," he added

26.title: Punjab man returning from Sri Anandpur Sahib dies as truck turns over car
26.article_body: A 50-year-old man, Gurdeep Singh, was killed while his wife, brother-in-law and another relative suffered injuries after a truck turned over their car in Jugiana village in Punjab. They were returning after paying their obeisance at Sri Anandpur Sahib on Hola Mohalla. Police have lodged an FIR against the unidentified driver of the truck who ran away from the spot.

27.title: 8-yr-old girl severely burnt by hot oil as puri bhaji vendors fight in Mumbai
27.article_body: An eight-year-old girl sustained severe burn injuries on her face and chest after hot oil fell on her during a fight between two puri bhaji vendors in Mumbai's Kurla, police said. The vendors, who were arrested later, run a food stall in Kasaiwada. The incident took place when the accused banged against a metal wok containing hot oil while fighting.

28.title: Working for Jeff Bezos was relentless, unforgiving: Former assistant
28.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' former executive assistant Ann Hiatt said working for Bezos was "relentless" and the environment could be "unforgiving". She told Insider, "In a single word (relentless), is who he is and who he wants his employees and...company to be." Notably, Bezos initially thought of naming the e-commerce giant 'Relentless.com' and the domain still leads to Amazon's website.

29.title: 2 dead, 1 critical as speeding bike hits divider, falls off flyover in Greater Noida
29.article_body: Two men died and another was critically injured after the bike they were travelling on hit a divider and fell off a flyover in the Surajpur area of Greater Noida, police said. "The three men were friends and had stepped out of their homes to play Holi. They were travelling on a bullet motorcycle and were over-speeding," Surajpur SHO said.

30.title: He's a frequent traveller to India, yet he hasn't received visa so far: CSK on Moeen Ali
30.article_body: Referring to all-rounder Moeen Ali having not joined the CSK squad yet, the team's CEO Kasi Viswanathan said that he had applied for visa on February 28 but hasn't received it yet. "He has been a frequent traveller to India and yet he has not got the travel papers," he added. He further said that even BCCI is helping them.

31.title: Hyd Police urge to keep distance between vehicles on road, share video
31.article_body: Hyderabad Police took to Twitter to share video on road safety. Police urged public to maintain distance between vehicles on road. "A driver driving behind another vehicle shall keep sufficient distance, commensurate with the traffic conditions, from the vehicle ahead, so as to be able to stop safely if the vehicle ahead suddenly slows down or stops," the tweet said.

32.title: 4 kill man after he objects to throwing colour during Holi in Pune
32.article_body: Four people have been booked after they allegedly murdered a 21-year-old man who objected to them throwing colour on him during Holi celebrations in Pune's Bibvewadi. The incident occurred on Friday when the accused, who were riding a two-wheeler, threw colour on the deceased. "The accused are absconding and teams have been deployed to nab them," a police official said.

33.title: Ephedrine worth ₹9.23cr found hidden in utensils at B'luru airport
33.article_body: Authorities said on Saturday that they have seized ephedrine worth ₹9.23 crore from the export shed at Bengaluru airport's cargo section, which had been hidden in a consignment declared as kitchen utensils. The package was being exported to Australia and contained ephedrine weighing 46.799 kg. Ephedrine had been concealed in the cavity of some of the utensils, the authorities added.

34.title: IPL 2014 Purple Cap winner Mohit Sharma working as net bowler for GT, fans react
34.article_body: Pacer Mohit Sharma, who had won the Purple Cap in IPL 2014 for taking 23 wickets for CSK, is working as a net bowler for Gujarat Titans. The 33-year-old pacer, who had a base price of ₹50 lakh, had gone unsold in mega auction. Reacting to the news, a fan tweeted, "Time is very powerful." "What a turnaround," wrote another.

35.title: Fire breaks out at car product factory in Pune; no casualties
35.article_body: A fire broke out at a car care product manufacturing unit in Pune's Kasurdi village on Saturday, reportedly gutting a lot of raw material. There were some workers manufacturing chemicals at the time, however, there were no casualties. "Our teams reached the spot fast. Firemen brought the situation under control in a couple of hours," said a fire official.

36.title: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie donates $281 mn to Boys & Girls Clubs of America
36.article_body: Philanthropist MacKenzie Scott has donated $281 million to Boys & Girls Clubs of America, marking the largest gift by an individual in the organisation's 160-year history. "Gifts like this are rare and have incredible impact," the organisation's President Jim Clark said. MacKenzie, who divorced Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos in 2019, has a net worth of $54.4 billion, as per Bloomberg.

37.title: Google rolls out feature to delete last 15 mins of search history on Android app
37.article_body: Google has started rolling out a feature that lets users delete the last 15 minutes of their search history on Android app. The feature will be rolled out to everyone in the next few weeks. To check if it's available, users can go to Google's Android app, tap on their profile picture and look for "Delete last 15 min" option.

38.title: Which countries are buying Russian oil & which countries have stopped doing so?
38.article_body: Amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Bulgaria, China, European Union, France, Germany continue to buy Russian oil. Indian ONGC's subsidiary Hindustan Petroleum and India's top refiner Indian Oil also recently bought oil from Russia. Many nations like Britain, Canada and US have stopped buying Russian oil. Australian refiner Ampol, Italian state-owned Eni have also stopped buying oil from Russia.

39.title: How does the 2022 Women's World Cup points table read after Australia's record win?
39.article_body: After registering the highest successful run chase in Women's World Cup history against India, Australia qualified for the semi-finals. Australia are on top of the points table with five wins out of five matches. India are currently fourth on the table, while Pakistan are last on the table having lost all of their matches so far.

40.title: PM Modi gifts Japanese PM Kishida a 'Krishna Pankhi' made of sandalwood
40.article_body: PM Narendra Modi gifted his Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida a 'Krishna Pankhi', an artefact made of pure sandalwood in Rajasthan. The Japanese PM is on a two-day visit to India. The artefact is intricately carved with traditional tools and has a hand-carved peacock figure at the top. The windows on the artefact depict different poses of Lord Krishna.

41.title: He changed his mind a fraction: Smith on why Babar missed out on his 200
41.article_body: Australia Test vice-captain Steve Smith has revealed why Pakistan captain Babar Azam couldn't score a double century in the drawn second Pakistan-Australia Test in Karachi. "When he was on a 196, perhaps he was looking for a boundary maybe through the off-side and just changed his mind a fraction knowing that he was so close to his 200," he added.

42.title: Sri Lanka cancels exams over paper shortage amid economic crisis
42.article_body: Exams for millions of school students in Sri Lanka were cancelled due to a shortage of paper, officials said on Saturday. "School principals cannot hold the tests as printers are unable to secure foreign exchange to import necessary paper and ink," the Education Department of Western Province said. Notably, this comes amid a severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka.

43.title: WHO lists 3 misleading facts amid surge in COVID-19 cases
43.article_body: Amid rise in COVID-19 cases globally, WHO's Maria Van Kerkhove listed three misleading facts about the virus that is causing confusion among people. "The misinformation that Omicron is mild. Misinformation that the pandemic is over. Misinformation that this is the last variant that we will have to deal with. This is really causing a lot of confusion," she stated.

44.title: We want democratic 'Khela Hobe' in WB, says BJP's Keya Ghosh
44.article_body: The BJP's candidate for Ballygunge Assembly by-polls, Keya Ghosh, on Saturday said they "don't want 'Khela Hobe' of murdering people but democratic 'Khela Hobe'". Her remark was in reference to TMC's slogan 'Khela Hobe' (Game's on). Commenting further about TMC candidate Babul Supriyo she said, "Earlier, he asked for votes for BJP and now he'll ask...against...People will laugh at him."

45.title: Fabric that can 'hear' a person's heartbeat made by MIT engineers
45.article_body: Engineers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have developed a fabric that can detect a wearer's subtle heartbeat. The fabric works like a microphone, converting sound into mechanical vibrations, then into electrical signals. It can detect sounds ranging in decibel from a quiet library to heavy road traffic. The fabric can also determine the precise direction of sudden sounds.

46.title: 20-year-old Indian shuttler Lakshya enters maiden final at All England
46.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen beat defending champion Lee Zii Jia of Malaysia 21-13, 12-21, 21-19 to reach his maiden final at All England Championships in Birmingham on Saturday. The 20-year-old became the fifth Indian shuttler to reach the final of the tournament. Prakash Padukone and Pullela Gopichand are the only Indians to have won the tournament.

47.title: Assam Traffic Police constable suspended for assaulting civilian
47.article_body: A traffic police constable in Guwahati, who was seen beating a motorcycle-borne man in a viral video, has been suspended for his alleged conduct of indiscipline following an order issued by deputy police commissioner. The video, which surfaced on Friday, shows a man travelling with his family before being repeatedly assaulted by constable Fakhruddin Ahmed at the Paltan Bazar area.

48.title: What's the criteria for making it tax-free?: 'Jhund' producer on 'The Kashmir Files'
48.article_body: After 'The Kashmir Files' was made tax-free in some states, a producer of Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Jhund' raised questions on the criteria on which a government "selects a film to support it so strongly". Saying that she was "perplexed" by state governments' support to 'The Kashmir Files', Savita Raj Hiremath said, "'Jhund' is also an important film and has a...big message."

49.title: Unlimited bouncers, bodyline bowling should be allowed in Test cricket: Shoaib Akhtar
49.article_body: Former Pakistani fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that unlimited bouncers and bodyline bowling should be allowed in Test match cricket, adding, "Why not? I want some character." He added, "Nowadays, [fast bowlers] are very soft. I don’t think the aggression is as much there now. I don’t know why."

50.title: Ukraine's Prez warns invasion will cost Russia for generations
50.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said continuing with its invasion of Ukraine would cost Russia losses that will take it "several generations to recover". Zelenskyy has urged Russian President Vladimir Putin to stop the invasion and hold peace talks with him. Notably, the advance of Russian forces has largely stalled amid heavy losses and local resistance, according to Reuters.

51.title: Bring back Subhas Chandra Bose's remains after DNA test: Netaji's grandnephew to Kishida
51.article_body: Amid Japanese PM Fumio Kishida's India visit, Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose's grandnephew Chandra Kumar Bose has requested Kishida to bring back Netaji's purported remains from Japan's Renkoji temple. "Request [Kishido] to facilitate DNA test of #Renkoji remains of the Hero of Asia & bring back the remains to India- the land he liberated from clutches of British imperialism," he tweeted.

52.title: Ghulam Nabi Azad meeting Sonia is a good sign: Mallikarjun Kharge
52.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Saturday said that G-23 leader Ghulam Nabi Azad meeting party President Sonia Gandhi was a good sign as Azad said he wants to strengthen the party. He added, "Azad has been in the party for years. He knows everything...He met Sonia Gandhi. He has spoken about keeping the party together."

53.title: Amit Shah reviews security situation in J&K, orders strengthening of NCB
53.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah today chaired a security review meeting with senior officials at Raj Bhawan in Jammu. During the meeting, Shah appreciated the improvement in the security situation and reduction in terror incidents in the valley, the Ministry of Home Affairs said. He ordered further strengthening of the Narcotics Control Bureau in J&K to choke narco-terrorism, MHA added.

54.title: We may not produce enough crops to export due to war: Ukraine
54.article_body: Ukrainian Presidential Advisor Oleh Ustenko on Saturday said Ukraine may not produce enough crops to export due to war between Ukraine and Russia. "Ukraine will not be able to export grain to the world, and there will be problems if the war continues," added Ustenko. Meanwhile, UN said 816 civilians were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded on February 24.

55.title: Sri Lanka to host Asia Cup T20 tournament from Aug 27 to Sept 11
55.article_body: Sri Lanka will be hosting Asia Cup 2022 from August 27 to September 11. The tournament will be played in a T20 format. The qualifiers for the same will be played August 20 onwards. There'll be six teams in the tournament, which includes India, Pakistan, Afghanistan, Bangladesh and hosts Sri Lanka and a qualifier. Notably, India are the defending champions.

56.title: Nagaland Assembly 1st in country to go paperless with e-Vidhan project
56.article_body: Nagaland's Legislative Assembly on Saturday became the first in the country to operationalise the National e-Vidhan Application (NeVA) for conducting a session in paperless mode. Tablets or e-books have been installed on the tables of the MLAs in the Secretariat. The cost of implementing the project was shared by the Centre and the state government on a 90:10 basis.

57.title: World no. 7 Rublev beats Dimitrov to reach Indian Wells semi-finals
57.article_body: World number seven Andrey Rublev on Friday beat Grigor Dimitrov 7-5, 6-2 to reach the semi-finals of the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells. Rublev's quarter-final victory was his 13th consecutive win so far. Rublev will face American Taylor Fritz in the semi-final, after Fritz beat Miomir Kecmanovic 7-6(5), 3-6, 6-1 in his quarter-final match.

58.title: Bharti Singh, who is expecting her 1st child, shares pics from her maternity shoot
58.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh, who is expecting her first child with her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa, on Saturday shared photos from the maternity photoshoot on Instagram. Sharing the photos, she wrote, "Aane wale baby ki mummy (mother to the soon-to-be-born baby)". Meanwhile, commenting on her post, Shamita Shetty wrote "Awww", while Rubina Dilaik wrote, "So pretty".

59.title: Bukayo Saka scores as Arsenal beat Aston Villa 1-0 in Premier League
59.article_body: Bukayo Saka on Saturday scored in the first-half to help Arsenal beat Aston Villa 1-0 in the Premier League. Arsenal now have 54 points in 28 games, five points behind Chelsea in third place. Arsenal play Crystal Palace next on Monday, April 4. Leeds United on Friday beat Wolves 3-2 after Luke Ayling scored the winner in the 91st minute.

60.title: Europa League quarter-finals draw out, Barcelona to face Frankfurt
60.article_body: Barcelona on Friday were drawn against Eintracht Frankfurt while West Ham United were drawn against Olympique Lyonnais in the UEFA Europa League quarter-final draw. Barcelona will face West Ham United in the semi-final if both teams win their respective quarter-final ties. The other quarter-final matches will see RB Leipzig face Atalanta while Braga will face Rangers.

61.title: 2 Chinese jets, 1 helicopter enter Taiwan air defence zone on Mar 18
61.article_body: Two Chinese Shenyang J-11 fighter jets and one Harbin Z-9 anti-submarine helicopter entered Taiwan's Air Defence Identification Zone (ADIZ) on Friday. In response, Taiwan's Ministry of National Defense issued radio warnings and deployed air defence missile systems to monitor the activities of the Chinese aircraft. This comes after Chinese aircraft carrier Shandong sailed through the Taiwan strait.

62.title: Court of Arbitration for Sport upholds FIFA's ban on Russian teams
62.article_body: The Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) on Friday said it has rejected a request by the Russian Football Union to freeze FIFA's ban on Russian teams. CAS added that the suspension of Russian teams and clubs from FIFA competitions will remain in force. Russia were scheduled to face Poland in a World Cup qualifying playoff on March 24.

63.title: We are not going to be in the race for a win: Hamilton on Bahrain GP
63.article_body: Seven-time Formula One world champion Lewis Hamilton said he will not be able to win the season-opening Bahrain Grand Prix after finishing in ninth place in the second practice session. Hamilton finished 1.2 seconds behind Red Bull's Max Verstappen. "So we are a long way off, and we are not bluffing like people assumed we were," he said.

64.title: Will prepare Shaheen physically, mentally for future challenges: Tait
64.article_body: Pakistan bowling coach Shaun Tait said Shaheen Shah Afridi is one of the most "dangerous" bowlers when he is fit. "I'll try to prepare him physically and mentally for future challenges," he added. The 21-year-old pacer took 78 wickets from 36 international matches last year. Tait was named Pakistan's bowling coach last month ahead of ongoing all-format series against Australia.

65.title: Japan PM invites PM Modi for Quad meet in Tokyo, calls India 'important partner'
65.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida on Saturday invited PM Narendra Modi for the Quad Summit Meeting in Tokyo and called India "a very important partner" for Japan. While addressing the 14th India-Japan Annual Summit, PM Kishida said, "We will hold the next India-Japan talks as soon as possible." Notably, India and Japan today signed several agreements in areas including cyber security.

66.title: Future Retail to hold shareholder meeting to vote on Reliance deal in April
66.article_body: Future Group companies, including Future Retail, have informed the stock exchanges that they will convene meetings of their respective shareholders and creditors in April to vote on the ₹24,713-crore deal with Reliance Retail. The development comes amid Reliance Industries' takeover of Future's stores. Future has said it's committed to taking all actions for the reversal of takeover of stores.

67.title: Blaming Gandhi family alone for election debacle is not right: Kharge
67.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Saturday said that blaming just the Gandhi family for Congress' performance in the elections is not right. Kharge said, "We've always wanted that everyone should come together to strengthen the party...We're all responsible, mentioning the Gandhi family alone is not right." This comes after Congress' loss in the recently held Assembly elections in five states.

68.title: Video shows the moment Russian hypersonic missile blew up Ukraine's weapon storage
68.article_body: Russia has released an aerial footage of the moment its Kinzhal hypersonic missile blew up Ukraine's weapon storage. "Destruction of a weapons depot of the Armed Forces of Ukraine by high-precision missile weapons strike. We can see the exact hit of an underground hangar with weapons and ammunition," Russia tweeted. It was the first time Russia deployed Kinzhal, Interfax reported.

69.title: He's absolute livewire, massive performer: Mayank on PBKS' new buy Shikhar
69.article_body: Talking about Shikhar Dhawan, who was bought by PBKS in IPL mega auction 2022, captain Mayank Agarwal said he's a massive performer, adding a lot of players will feed off his energy. "He's an absolute livewire, a great entertainer...he's also in...great mind space," he added. With 587 runs from 16 matches, Shikhar was top-scorer for DC in IPL 2021.

70.title: Pak military is not taking sides in political crisis: Opp'n leader
70.article_body: During a TV interview, Leader of Opposition in Pakistani Parliament Shehbaz Sharif said that the military has not taken any sides in the current political crisis in the country. The Opposition has tabled a no-confidence motion against Pakistan's PM Imran Khan. Voting on the no-confidence motion is likely to be held on March 28, according to a report.

71.title: Dhanush makes 1st public appearance after divorce from Aishwarya Rajinikanth
71.article_body: Pictures have surfaced of actor Dhanush with his sons Yatra and Linga at a concert by lyricist Ilaiyaraaja in Chennai. This is the actor's first public appearance after his divorce from Aishwarya Rajinikanth in January 2022. The actor was also seen singing on the stage during the concert, in videos shared by fans online.

72.title: 'Human error' a factor in Abu Dhabi F1 race controversy but result valid: FIA report
72.article_body: FIA released its report on the F1 2021's controversial season-ending Abu Dhabi race, which saw Max Verstappen overtake Lewis Hamilton in the final lap. FIA said "human error" was responsible for the incorrect application of safety car rules, however, the then race director Michael Masi acted in "good faith". The report ruled result of the race is "valid and final".

73.title: Russia has lost $860 million this year due to internet shutdowns: Report
73.article_body: A report by an independent research firm Top10VPN.com has revealed that a deliberate internet outage has led Russia to lose $861 million since January 2022. Ranking at the top spot, Russia is followed by Kazakhstan's losses at $429.5 million. As per NetBlocks, this cost represents how much a country's population could lose from censorship of the internet and social media.

74.title: Russia's richest man's property worth $116 million seized by Italy
74.article_body: Italian authorities have seized a building complex owned by Russian businessman Alexei Mordashov, Prime Minister Mario Draghi's office announced. The property is located on the Mediterranean island of Sardinia and is worth around $116 million. Earlier this month, a 215-foot yacht worth more than $71 million, called the "Lady M", belonging to Russia's richest man Mordashov was impounded in Italy.

75.title: Whole world has been shaken, close partnership important for Japan & India: Japan PM
75.article_body: In a joint statement with PM Narendra Modi, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said, "The whole world has been shaken today due to many disturbances. It's very important for India and Japan to have a close partnership." Stating that both the leaders talked about Russia-Ukraine war, PM Kishida said, "We need a peaceful solution on the basis of international law."

76.title: Japan to invest ₹3.2 lakh crore over the next 5 years in India: PM Modi
76.article_body: While releasing a joint statement with Japanese PM Fumio Kishida in Delhi, PM Narendra Modi said Japan will raise its investment target in India to 5 trillion yen or ₹3.2 lakh crores over the next five years. "Japan is one of India's largest investors. India-Japan are working as 'One team- One project' on Mumbai-Ahmedabad high-speed rail corridor," he added.

77.title: Will provide all possible support to Japanese firms in India: PM Modi
77.article_body: Speaking at India-Japan Economic Forum on Saturday, PM Narendra Modi said that India is committed to providing all possible support to Japanese companies in India. He further said, "Progress, prosperity and partnership are the basis of India-Japan relations." This comes as PM Modi today met Japanese PM Fumio Kishida, who's on a two-day visit to India, and held bilateral talks.

78.title: At least 130 people rescued from theatre bombed by Russia: Ukraine
78.article_body: Ukrainian officials said at least 130 people have been rescued from a theatre in Mariupol that Ukraine said was bombed by Russia on Wednesday. Officials added that over 1,300 people remain trapped under the rubble as President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said rescue operations continue at the site. No confirmations have been given so far as to the number of possible casualties.

79.title: UK donates 2 million medical items to Ukraine in past 3 weeks
79.article_body: The UK has donated two million medical items to Ukraine over the past three weeks. "We're leading the humanitarian effort to support Ukraine by providing targeted medical support to those in need," UK Health Secretary Sajid Javid said. The Department of Health and Social Care said insulin shots, painkillers and intensive care equipment will reach Ukraine in the coming days.

80.title: Russian Prez Putin is in better shape than ever: Belarus' Prez
80.article_body: Belarus' President Alexander Lukashenko has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is "in better shape than ever". "I'm absolutely privy to all his details, as far as possible, both state and personal," he added. Notably, this comes after British PM Boris Johnson has suggested Putin is being "irrational" and Dutch PM Mark Rutte has described him as "totally paranoid".

81.title: UK's luxury department store Harrods admits to 'mistakenly' selling Russian vodka
81.article_body: Luxury British department store Harrods admitted that it "mistakenly" sold an expensive brand of Russian vodka, having previously removed the bottles after sanctions against Russia due to the Ukraine war. Harrods spokesperson said, "After an inquiry by a customer, it was mistakenly brought out of stock and given to the customer. This was an error and shouldn't have happened."

82.title: Greek farmers protest against rising fuel prices amid Ukraine war
82.article_body: Hundreds of Greek farmers on Friday protested against high fuel and fertiliser prices that have increased following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The Greek government has spent over $4 billion since September to help farmers, businesses and households from rising energy and fuel costs. The UN food agency last week said international food prices could rise by up to 20%.

83.title: Zoo near Kyiv requests humanitarian corridor to evacuate animals
83.article_body: A zoo near Kyiv has requested a humanitarian corridor to evacuate animals or for volunteers to bring food for larger animals amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The owner of the Park XII Months zoo Mykhailo Pinchuk said there is no electricity or gas in the park. Animals in the zoo have reportedly begun to die due to cold or hunger.

84.title: KKR is a lucky team for me, delighted to be back: Pacer Umesh
84.article_body: Pacer Umesh Yadav, who was part of KKR's title-winning campaign in IPL 2014, said he's delighted to be back in the Kolkata-based franchise. "Because KKR has given me that experience of winning a trophy so you can say that KKR is a lucky team for me," he added. The 34-year-old had represented DC in IPL 2021.

85.title: Bhavana makes 1st public appearance after rape incident, gets standing ovation
85.article_body: Malayalam actress Bhavana Menon made a surprise appearance at the International Film Festival of Kerala (IFFK) on Friday. This was Bhavana's first public appearance after she was allegedly abducted and raped by actor Dileep and others in a car in 2017. She received thunderous applause and a standing ovation from the crowd, a video of which has also surfaced.

86.title: How does the Cricket World Cup Super League table read after Bangladesh's historic win?
86.article_body: After their first-ever ODI victory on South African soil, Bangladesh are on top of Cricket World Cup Super League points table with 110 points. South Africa are at the 10th position, while Australia are seventh. England are second on the table and India are on third position. Pakistan are ninth. Top-seven ranked teams will automatically qualify for 2023 World Cup.

87.title: AIMIM is BJP's 'B team' which was proved in UP polls: Sanjay Raut
87.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Saturday dubbed Asaduddin Owaisi-led AIMIM as the "B team" of BJP. "The AIMIM has a secret alliance with the BJP which was proved in Uttar Pradesh and West Bengal elections," he said. Raut also rejected the suggestion of AIMIM to be part of the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) alliance in Maharashtra.

88.title: Real warning sign for other teams: Lisa on Harmanpreet's 57* vs Aus in WC
88.article_body: Calling Harmanpreet Kaur's 47-ball 57* against Australia "an excellent innings" in ongoing Women's World Cup, ex-Australia captain Lisa Sthalekar said the India vice-captain was able to build up the half-century. "It's a real warning sign for other teams that she is starting to fire because we know how big she can go," she added. Australia beat India by six wickets.

89.title: Pakistan logs 483 new COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths in last 24 hours
89.article_body: Pakistani authorities on Saturday said the country reported 483 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), 2 new deaths were recorded taking total death toll to 30,328. This comes as NCOC announced relaxation of all COVID-19 norms in the country. However, positivity rate has jumped up to 1.23% from 1.08%.

90.title: Nearly 200 people wounded in Sudan's anti-coup protests: Report
90.article_body: Central Committee of Sudan Doctors (CCSD) on Friday said 187 anti-coup protesters were wounded in clashes with police in Khartoum on March 17. This comes as riot police used rubber bullets and tear gas to disperse the protesters who were marching towards the Republican Palace, seat of the military government. Sudan has plunged into crisis since last year's military coup.

91.title: Taiwan reports 126 new COVID-19 cases, zero deaths in last 24 hours
91.article_body: Taiwan on Saturday logged 126 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths in last 24 hours. As per Taiwan's Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC), out of 126 new cases, 120 were imported cases and six were locally transmitted infections. The agency added that out of the new local infections, three were contacts of recently confirmed cases.

92.title: Very happy to start new journey: Gill on joining GT camp ahead of IPL
92.article_body: Upon his arrival in the Gujarat Titans squad in Ahmedabad ahead of upcoming IPL 2022, Shubman Gill said he's very happy to start his new journey with the franchise. "I'll be out there on the field very soon," he added. Gill, who was released by KKR before IPL mega auction last month, was picked by Gujarat Titans for ₹8 crore.

93.title: India may soon top hate and anger charts: Rahul Gandhi
93.article_body: Citing India's global ranking on various parameters, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday tweeted that India may soon "top the Hate and Anger charts!". "Hunger Rank: 101, Freedom Rank: 119, Happiness Rank: 136," he wrote in the tweet. Notably, Rahul Gandhi's comment comes after India moved up three spots this year in the UN-sponsored World Happiness Report.

94.title: Hyd Police seizes illegal gutka, tobacco products worth ₹2 lakh
94.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Saturday apprehended two persons for allegedly buying and selling noxious gutka and seized illegal gutka and tobacco products worth ₹2,47,050 from their possession. According to police, one of the accused purchased the gutka from Karnataka and distributed it at pan shops in and around the Secunderabad area and had also hired a godown for storage of goods.

95.title: CBSE announces Class 12 Term 1 examination results
95.article_body: The Central Board of Secondary Education on Saturday announced the results of Class 12 Term 1 examination. The CBSE has reportedly sent marksheets of the examination to individual schools. The Class 10 Term 1 result was announced last week in offline mode, and the students' marksheets were shared with schools over mail.

96.title: UK woman left 4 inches shorter after water slide accident, seeks £500,000 damages
96.article_body: A British tourist has said she was left four inches shorter after breaking her spine on a 40-foot-tall "Banzai" water slide while she was on a holiday in Spain. Jennifer Proctor said the 2019 accident led to her height being reduced to 5 feet 7 inches and has launched a £500,000 (₹5 crore) damages claim against Aqualand waterpark in Mallorca.

97.title: 28-yr-old woman finds 10kg tumour with teeth & hair growing inside ovary in US
97.article_body: A 28-year-old US woman has said she discovered a nearly 10-kg tumour with teeth and hair was growing inside her ovary when she consulted a doctor after struggling to lose weight. She was diagnosed with a teratoma tumour, which is a slow-growing tumour. "I was in shock, as that's like having three kids inside of you," the woman said.

98.title: VHP condemns attack on ISKCON temple in Dhaka, demands strict action
98.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad has condemned the attack on an ISKCON temple in Bangladesh's capital Dhaka, saying the attack is "very worrying and exposes the human rights and Islamophobia". VHP also urged the Bangladesh government  to ensure the safety of Hindus and give punishment to the attackers. The temple was reportedly attacked on Thursday by a mob of around 200 people.

99.title: US dentist found guilty of breaking patients' teeth to earn profit by fixing them
99.article_body: A dentist in the US has been found guilty of healthcare fraud and other charges after he purposely damaged his patients' teeth to bill insurance companies for further procedures to earn profit. The 61-year-old dentist billed over $4.2 million for crown procedures between 2016 and 2019. Notably, by the end of 2020, he had over $6.8 million worth of assets.

100.title: Fielding didn't back the bowlers: Mithali on India's loss vs Aus in WC
100.article_body: After India's six-wicket loss against Australia in 2022 Women's World Cup, India captain Mithali Raj said her side's fielding didn't back the bowlers when they needed the fielders to stand up and support them. "Next two games become very important and we would look to do well in all departments," she added. India are currently fourth in standings.

101.title: Be alert: Centre to Maha as COVID-19 cases rise in China, S Korea
101.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope said on Saturday that the state government received a letter from the Central government, asking it to stay alert as COVID-19 cases are increasing in China, South Korea and European nations. "Accordingly, our health department had issued a letter to DCs to be cautious and take necessary steps," he added.

102.title: We are not opposing moral education: Ex-K'taka CM Siddaramaiah
102.article_body: Leader of the Opposition in the Karnataka Legislative Assembly and former Chief Minister Siddaramaiah on Saturday said, "We're not opposing moral teachings. We believe in the constitution and secularism."  "Let the government teach Bhagavad Gita, Quran or Bible as part of moral education," he added. "We don't have any objection, provided children get quality education," he further said.

103.title: Police seizes 5 kg methadone worth ₹5 crore in MP; 2 arrested
103.article_body: Police and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) on Friday intercepted a truck on the Betul-Nagpur Highway in Madhya Pradesh and recovered 5 kg of the drug methadone worth ₹5 crore. The two occupants of the truck, who were arrested, claimed to be carriers transporting the consignment from Assam to Mandsaur, police said, adding that further probe is underway.

104.title: Netherlands to increase wind farms for doubling wind capacity by 2030
104.article_body: The Netherlands to increase offshore wind farms for doubling the planned capacity by 2030. A source revealed that government is set to announce new wind farms with a capacity of 10.7 gigawatts (GW) that would be built by end of this decade. This comes as government is working to achieve its climate goals and lessen reliance on Russian gas.

105.title: Hyd Police seize 16g brown sugar transported from WB; 4 arrested
105.article_body: A Special Operations Team of Hyderabad Police on Saturday busted an interstate drugs racket and apprehended four persons involved. Around 16 grams of brown sugar were seized from their possession which, according to police, was transported from West Bengal to Hyderabad. Police also seized five mobile phones, ₹1,900 in cash and a weighing machine among other materials.

106.title: Over 2,000 people fined for traffic violations on Holi in Delhi: Police
106.article_body: Delhi Police on Saturday said that more than 2,000 people were fined for traffic violations in the city on the occasion of Holi. Police said that 1,673 persons have been prosecuted for travelling without a helmet on Holi. Furthermore, the police said that 275 persons have been prosecuted for triple riding, 196 for drunken driving and 25 for dangerously driving.

107.title: 26-yr-old Mumbai man dies after falling off terrace during Holi
107.article_body: A 26-year-old man died after falling from the terrace of a four-storey building in Mumbai's Ambernath where he had tried to hide while playing Holi with his friends on Friday. Suraj More was rushed to the hospital but was declared dead during treatment. Police have registered an accidental death report in the matter and are awaiting his post-mortem report.

108.title: Ukraine is opening to the world: Vice PM as Musk sends more Starlink terminals
108.article_body: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to share that the country has received a new batch of Starlink satellite internet terminals amid war with Russia. Thanking SpaceX CEO Elon Musk, he said, "While Russia is blocking access to the Internet, Ukraine is becoming more open to the entire world. Ukraine is the truth. The truth always wins."

109.title: What's wrong with saffronising education, shed colonial mindset: VP
109.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu said the government is accused of saffronising education but "what is wrong with saffron". "We must give up our colonial mindset and teach our children to take pride in their Indian identity," he said. He also called for rejecting Macaulay's system of education in the 75th year of Independence. He made the comments in Haridwar.

110.title: What are humanitarian corridors created in Ukraine & are they safe?
110.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday said that 10 humanitarian corridors have been agreed on with the Russians. These corridors are safe passages created in war zones by stopping assault for a certain time, either to allow civilians to flee or to allow urgent humanitarian aid to enter. There have been instances of the ceasefire being breached in these corridors, including in Mariupol.

111.title: Hong Kong's COVID-19 cases cross 1 million mark since pandemic began
111.article_body: Hong Kong logged 10,16,944 COVID-19 cases since the pandemic began after the authorities reported 20,079 new infections on Friday. The officials added that the city reported 265 deaths in the same period bringing the total death toll to 5,401. Notably, nearly 97% of the overall caseload came from the current Omicron-driven outbreak which is Hong Kong's fifth wave.

112.title: 28-yr-old man shot at under reclamation bridge in Mumbai's Bandra
112.article_body: A 28-year-old man was shot by three bike-borne assailants near Mumbai's Bandra reclamation bridge on Thursday. The complainant Riyaz Ansari, who has eight criminal cases against him, alleged that two assailants threatened him before the third, Munna Pathan, fired at him. He further claimed Pathan had tried to kill him as he registered an FIR against some hotel employees earlier.

113.title: He's chilled, very approachable and a helpful soul: Shikhar on Rohit
113.article_body: Praising Rohit Sharma, India opener Shikhar Dhawan said the captain is a "gem" of a person and a very "helpful soul". He added, "He's chilled, relaxed, smart and very approachable...and he may be...captain now, but for those who know him, he's the same Rohit." As an opening combination, Rohit and Dhawan have scored 4,994 runs in 111 innings so far.

114.title: US to deploy Stryker army company as part of Bulgaria's NATO troops
114.article_body: Bulgarian PM Kiril Petkov on Saturday said US will provide a Stryker mechanised infantry company for Bulgaria's NATO battlegroup. "This is a strong sign to all our allies in NATO," he said during a joint press conference with US Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin. This comes as Bulgaria is establishing a battlegroup of up to 1,000 troops amid Russia-Ukraine war.

115.title: China's Wuhan vows to create 100 billion yuan space industry by 2025
115.article_body: China's Wuhan on Wednesday vowed to create a 100 billion yuan ($15.7 billion) space industry by 2025. As per a city government notice, authorities are offering companies up to 50 million yuan ($7.88 million) as financial incentives in manufacturing projects of satellites, rockets and spacecraft. This comes as Wuhan aims to become the country's "valley of satellites".

116.title: Scientists find 36-mn-year-old fossil of ancestor of whales in Peru
116.article_body: Palaeontologists on Thursday announced that they have discovered a 36-million-year-old skull belonging to a prehistoric ancestor of modern-day whales in Peru's southern Ocucaje desert. Scientists believed that the ancient marine animal was likely a 12-metres long basilosaurus whose descendants are whales, dolphins and porpoises. The team added that the fossil contained rows of long, pointy teeth.

117.title: B'luru policemen fix tyre of ambulance carrying mother, child; praised
117.article_body: Bengaluru's Sadashivanagar Traffic ASI Pushpakaran and police constable Huded helped in replacing the punctured tyre of an ambulance, which was carrying a mother and child. "The timely help ensured the mother and child to reach the hospital in time," DCP Traffic East tweeted. Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar praised them, saying, "Great gesture Bengaluru City Traffic Police! Appreciate it!"

118.title: Ex-UK PM Cameron driving small lorry to Poland with aid for Ukrainians, shares pic
118.article_body: Former United Kingdom Prime Minister David Cameron is driving a small lorry to Poland with humanitarian aid for Ukrainian refugees. Cameron and his two Chippy Larder colleagues will give the donations to Red Cross when they reach Poland. He added that donations are filled "with everything from nappies to sanitary products, warm clothes to first-aid kits".

119.title: Brazil bans Telegram, CEO says 'company was checking wrong email id for orders'
119.article_body: After Brazil’s Supreme Court banned Telegram for facilitating disinformation and failing to comply with orders, CEO Pavel Durov issued a statement saying that the company was checking the wrong email address for communications with the court. Durov said the company had given a different email address for further communication but the court sent the orders to an old email address.

120.title: PM Modi meets Japan PM at Hyderabad House in Delhi; greet each other with Namaste
120.article_body: Japan PM Fumio Kishida, who is on a two-day visit to India, met PM Narendra Modi at Hyderabad House in Delhi on Saturday. The two leaders greeted each other with Namaste, a video of their meeting showed. Besides holding bilateral talks with PM Modi, PM Kishida will take part in the 14th India-Japan Annual Summit.

121.title: Italian researchers survey and study Europe's Calderone glacier
121.article_body: Italian researchers conducted a preliminary radar survey of Europe's Calderone glacier on March 13. As the scientists plan to study the glacier before it melts due to global warming, the team plans to return in April to drill into it and take samples. According to the researchers, these samples will be stored in 'Ice Memory' world archive in Antarctica.

122.title: B'luru Police apprehends man for cricket betting, seizes ₹1 lakh cash
122.article_body: Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru Police has conducted a raid on cricket betting gamblers and apprehended a man, identified as Sampath G, police said on Friday. Police also seized cash worth more than ₹1 lakh and a mobile phone from the possession of the accused person. This comes as India-Sri Lanka pink-ball Test recently concluded in Bengaluru with India's win.

123.title: Strategic 434-km long Srinagar-Leh highway reopens after 73 days
123.article_body: The strategic 434-km long Srinagar-Leh national highway was reopened on Saturday after being closed for 73 days due to heavy snowfall, officials said. However, the officials added that the decision to open the highway for civil traffic will be taken after a joint inspection by the civil administration.

124.title: Ukrainian military imposes 38-hour curfew in Zaporizhzhia: Official
124.article_body: Zaporizhzhia Deputy Mayor Anatoliy Kurtiev on Saturday said Ukrainian military has imposed a 38-hour curfew in southern city of Zaporizhzhia. As per Kurtiev, the curfew will stay in place from today till early Monday, March 21. This comes as the regional capital city has become a vital transit point for about 35,000 civilians who have fled besieged city of Mariupol.

125.title: Cummins is happy if we drop chances as long as ball carries, jokes Smith
125.article_body: Discussing pitches for Pakistan's Tests against Australia, Steve Smith said there is no bounce, joking that Australia Test captain Pat Cummins is happy if the slip fielders drop chances as long as the ball carries. "I've never stood as close to the bat for pace bowlers in my life, in any conditions," added Smith. "It's been exceptionally difficult," stated Smith.

126.title: SP-ally Rajbhar denies meeting Shah, says 'old pic' circulating
126.article_body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief OP Rajbhar, an ally of SP, has denied reports of him meeting Union Home Minister Amit Shah. "Those are old photos. Someone can repost the old photos and say whatever they want," said Rajbhar. "The reports are baseless. Neither did I go to Delhi nor did I meet anyone," Rajbhar added.

127.title: We must give up colonial mindset, take pride in Indian identity: Naidu
127.article_body: Vice President Venkaiah Naidu on Saturday asked Indians to give up their "colonial mindset" and learn to take pride in their own identity. He also called for total rejection of the Macaulay system of education in the 75th year of Independence. "We must learn Sanskrit to know our scriptures, which are a treasure trove of knowledge," he said.

128.title: Inspired by film Valimai, 2 men steal bikes in Coimbatore; arrested
128.article_body: Inspired by the film Valimai starring Ajith, a 23-year-old man and his 17-year-old neighbour allegedly stole motorcycles in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. The Saravanampatti police arrested them on Wednesday. "Inspired by the movie, they started to steal parked motorcycles and sold them for as low as 5,000," Inspector Senthilkumar said. Police also recovered 11 motorcycles from their possession.

129.title: 25,000 jobs to be notified in 1 month: Punjab CM after cabinet meet
129.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann presided over his first cabinet meeting on Saturday and later said the cabinet passed a proposal to issue 25,000 government job notifications in one month. This includes 10,000 vacancies in Punjab Police and 15,000 vacancies in other government departments. "As we promised...job opportunities...will be the top priority of the AAP government," Mann said.

130.title: It is meant for global audience: Vidya Balan on 'Jalsa' releasing on OTT
130.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan while talking about her film 'Jalsa' getting released on OTT rather than the theatres said the film is meant for the global audience. "Both the story and the narrative are universal," said Vidya Balan. Actress Shefali Shah, who also stars in the film, added, "We all want to be a part of global cinema."

131.title: They are a part of us: Maniesh Paul on ill-treatment of LGBTQ+ community
131.article_body: Actor and TV host Maniesh Paul while expressing his disappointment on the ill-treatment of LGBTQ+ community said, "They are very much...part of us." "They are part of our world and society whom we were ignoring for a long time," he added while talking to former Mr Gay India Sushant Divgikr in the latest episode of 'The Maniesh Paul Podcast'.

132.title: 6.5 million people displaced inside Ukraine due to war: UN
132.article_body: The UN migration agency said that nearly 6.5 million people are displaced within Ukraine and over 3.2 million have fled the country due to war. "Over 12 million people are estimated to be stranded in affected areas or unable to leave due to heightened security risks, destruction of...roads...lack of resources or information on where to find safety," it added.

133.title: There were times I'd be desperate when I was about to get dropped: Dhawan
133.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan said there were times when he would be desperate when he was about to be dropped from Team India, adding that he used to compete aggressively. "I have seen...ups and downs playing for the Indian team," stated Dhawan. "T20 World Cup 2022 is coming. If I do well in...IPL 2022, I can get into the side," he said.

134.title: India's forex reserves decline by $9.6 bn in biggest weekly drop in 2 yrs
134.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves declined by $9.646 billion to $622.275 billion in the week ending March 11, marking its biggest weekly drop in nearly two years, data shared by the Reserve Bank of India showed. The decline was on account of a fall in foreign currency assets (FCA), a major component of the overall reserves, which decreased by $11.108 billion.

135.title: Bulgaria won't send military aid to Ukraine: PM Petkov
135.article_body: Bulgarian PM Kiril Petkov said the country will not be able to provide military aid to Ukraine as it's "too close to the conflict". Bulgaria, a NATO ally, will continue to provide humanitarian assistance, he added. Bulgaria also announced that it'll host a new contingent of NATO troops as part of the military alliance's push to strengthen its eastern flank.

136.title: As a leader you have to do it: Gambhir on IPL 2013 spat with Kohli
136.article_body: Discussing his spat with Virat Kohli while leading KKR in an IPL 2013 match against RCB, Gautam Gambhir said, "When you are leading...you have to do it...because you want your team to play...[like] you want." "You are not thinking about personal relationships with the other guy," added Gambhir. Ex-KKR player Rajat Bhatia had to step in and separate them.

137.title: I learnt a lot from bad IPL 2021 season, won't let it change me: Pooran
137.article_body: Having scored 85 runs in 12 IPL 2021 matches for PBKS, West Indies wicketkeeper-batter Nicholas Pooran said he has learnt a lot from his "bad" season but won't let it change him as a player. "First game...I got a first-ball duck..., next game...a second-ball duck," added Pooran. Pooran recorded four ducks in his opening six IPL 2021 matches.

138.title: Police probe into hijab row targeted us, alleges CFI's K'taka head
138.article_body: The Karnataka chief of the Campus Front of India (CFI), Athavulla Punjalkatte, has alleged that the police probe into the hijab row was "selective" and "targeted" the organisation. In an interview with the Indian Express, Punjalkatte reacted to the Karnataka High Court's judgement uphold the ban on hijab by saying, "We are with petitioner students and we'll fight it legally."

139.title: 20-year-old arrested for kidnapping & raping 17-year-old girl in UP
139.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police arrested a 20-year-old man for allegedly kidnapping and raping a 17-year-old girl. On December 22, the girl had gone missing from a village under Rasra police station. Her father registered a case on February 16. Acting on a tip-off, the police arrested the accused on Thursday. The girl was sent for medical examination to the district hospital.

140.title: What are the features of Kinzhal hypersonic missiles used by Russia in Ukraine?
140.article_body: Russia has claimed to have used Kinzhal (meaning dagger) hypersonic missiles in Ukraine to blast a weapons' storage. They have a reported range of 1,500-2,000 km and can carry a payload that's 33 times the yield of the Fat Man bomb that was dropped on Hiroshima. They fly at 10 times the speed of sound and can overcome air-defence systems.

141.title: Kiara praises her dad's 'childhood friend' Juhi Chawla, calls her 'aunty'
141.article_body: Kiara Advani, during an interview, referred to Juhi Chawla as "aunty" while revealing that the actress is her father Jagdeep Advani's childhood friend. When pointed out that she called Juhi "aunty", Kiara laughed and said she doesn't think Juhi will "kill" her for it. "She's very grounded. I never felt that she was a huge film star," Kiara further said.

142.title: Ready to ally with Cong or NCP; not 'B' team of BJP: AIMIM MP
142.article_body: Aurangabad MP and AIMIM leader, Imtiaz Jaleel, has said that his party is willing to ally with the NCP and Congress for civic polls in Maharashtra. Jaleel said that it is always alleged that BJP wins because of AIMIM splitting votes. Jaleel added that to prove AIMIM is not a 'B' team of BJP, he "proposed...for the alliance".

143.title: It took me to really dark places: Arjun on 1 yr of 'Sandeep Aur Pinky...'
143.article_body: As 'Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar' completed one year of its release on Saturday, Arjun Kapoor said, "[It] took me to really dark places in my heart." "Though it was extremely uncomfortable for me, it made me deliver a performance that people have called my career-best," he added. Directed by Dibakar Banerjee, the crime drama also featured Parineeti Chopra.

144.title: Pressure like batting on Day 1: Du Plessis on first RCB training session
144.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis compared his first RCB training session after three days of quarantine, to the pressure of batting on the first day in a Test match. Du Plessis will be leading an IPL franchise for the first time, having replaced Virat Kohli who was the franchise's captain from 2013 to 2021. He has played 100 IPL matches.

145.title: Noida, Ghaziabad to host school books exchange fair tomorrow
145.article_body: Ghaziabad Parents Association and Gautam Budh Nagar Parents Welfare Society will organise a school books exchange fair tomorrow. Parents will be able to donate their child's old school books and in return, they can get books donated by others for their child's new academic session. The fair will be held in Noida's Sector 52 community hall and Ghaziabad's Shastri Nagar.

146.title: Which superyachts owned by Russians have been seized due to the war in Ukraine?
146.article_body: Several superyachts have been seized from Russian oligarchs after sanctions by US and European Union due to Ukraine war. The seized superyachts include 213-foot Lady M owned by Alexei Mordashov, Gennady Timchenko's 132-foot Lena, Andrey Melnichenko's 470-foot-long Sy A, 279-foot Valerie, 289-foot Amore Vero owned by Igor Sechin, 450-foot Dilbar and 445-foot Crescent and 157-foot Lady Anastasia.

147.title: 112 children killed in ongoing war in Ukraine: Official
147.article_body: At least 112 children have been killed in the war in Ukraine so far, the Ukrainian prosecutor general's office said on Saturday. Around 140 children have been injured, it added. On Friday, scores of empty strollers were lined up in the central square of Lviv city to commemorate the children killed in the country since Russia's invasion.

148.title: Kohli forces himself to hit by using the crease in the powerplay: Jaffer
148.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said it seems like Virat Kohli forces himself to hit by using the crease in the powerplay, adding that Kohli should bat at number three rather than opening the innings for RCB. "Kohli's somebody who takes some time initially and then his strike rate progressively goes up," stated Jaffer. Kohli scored 405 runs in IPL 2021.

149.title: 16-yr-old girl shot in back, lungs by Russian soldiers while saving brother, survives
149.article_body: A 16-year-old Ukrainian girl was shot in the back, lungs, ribs and thighs by Russian troops while covering her eight-year-old brother from the attack. The girl survived the attack and is currently hospitalised in Kyiv. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy also visited the girl and her family at the hospital and gave her a bouquet of pink and white flowers.

150.title: Drunk man stabs self 4 times while dancing on Holi in MP, video surfaces
150.article_body: A man who appeared to be drunk stabbed himself four times with a knife while dancing during a Holi celebration in MP's Indore. A video of the incident shows the man accidentally stabbing himself while reportedly appearing to pull off a stunt. He was rushed to a hospital where he succumbed to his injuries, police said.

151.title: Czech designer makes 'Zelenskyy pillows', raises over ₹14 lakh for Ukraine
151.article_body: A Czech designer is making pillows bearing the portrait of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who according to him has become a “sex symbol” for some. Tomas Brinek said that he has already received 2,000 orders for these pillows and has raised $18,900 (over ₹14 lakh) for a charity helping Ukrainians amid the war.

152.title: Our film important too: 'Jhund' maker as Kashmir Files declared tax-free
152.article_body: Reacting to 'The Kashmir Files' being made tax-free in multiple states across the country, Savita Raj Hiremath, one of the producers of 'Jhund', said she's "perplexed" as to why her film wasn't declared tax-free. She said 'Jhund' is also an important film and has a subject "that's crucial to our country's growth". 'Jhund', starring Amitabh Bachchan, released on March 4.

153.title: 23-yr-old man arrested for raping class 10 girl in Karnataka
153.article_body: A 23-year-old man was arrested by Karnataka's Annigeri Police on Friday for allegedly raping a class 10 girl. The accused took the minor to a field forcibly on his bike, raped her repeatedly and also threatened to kill her if she disclosed the matter to anybody, police said. Her parents, however, lodged a police complaint after learning about the crime.

154.title: Japan's PM arrives for 2-day visit, Railways Minister welcomes him
154.article_body: Japan's PM Fumio Kishida arrived in Delhi on Saturday for his two-day visit and was welcomed by Union Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. He is scheduled to participate in the 14th India-Japan annual summit and hold bilateral talks with PM Narendra Modi. This is Kishida's first visit to India after taking office last year and his first meeting with PM Modi.

155.title: At least 12 migrants drown in shipwreck off Tunisia
155.article_body: At least 12 migrants, mostly Syrians, drowned in a shipwreck off Tunisia on Friday as they tried to cross the Mediterranean Sea to Italy, a civil protection official said. As per reports, several people have drowned off the Tunisian coast in recent months, with an increase in the frequency of attempted crossings to Europe from Tunisia and Libya towards Italy.

156.title: Mario Balotelli dropped from Italy squad for FIFA WC playoffs
156.article_body: Italian footballer Mario Balotelli was dropped from the country's squad for next week's FIFA World Cup playoff match. Earlier, Balotelli was recalled to the national team in January after almost three years. However, Luiz Felipe and Joao Pedro were included in the 33-member national squad. Italy will play against North Macedonia in a must-win game on March 25.

157.title: Rafael Nadal is like a computer, he can see through motion: Annacone
157.article_body: Tennis commentator Paul Annacone said Rafael Nadal's mind is like a computer, adding that he can "see through motion" on the tennis court to make good decisions which is tough. "It's been so much fun to watch Rafa [solve problems] and find...ways to get through matches," stated Annacone. Nadal recently recorded his 19th consecutive win in the ATP Tour season.

158.title: Nawab Malik will have to resign, divesting portfolio not enough: Fadnavis
158.article_body: NCP leader Nawab Malik will have to resign and divesting portfolio is not enough, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said. "We'll not relent until he resigns. His continuation in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government as a Cabinet minister is not only unethical but goes against the spirit of the Constitution," Fadnavis added. ED arrested Malik in a money laundering case.

159.title: Some films inspire change, Kashmir Files incites hate: Cong's Jairam
159.article_body: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Saturday criticised the newly-released 'The Kashmir Files' and said that while some films inspire change, the Vivek Agnihotri directorial incites hate. "Truth can lead to justice, rehabilitation, reconciliation and peace. Propaganda twists facts, distorts history to whip up anger and promote violence," he tweeted. Several BJP members have lauded the movie.

160.title: Father, brother, grandfather, uncle rape 11-year-old girl over 5 years in Pune
160.article_body: Pune Police have booked an 11-year-old girl's father, brother, grandfather and uncle for allegedly raping and sexually assaulting her over the last five years. Her father allegedly raped her when they lived in Bihar in 2017 and she was later raped by her brother when she moved to Pune. Her grandfather and uncle sexually abused her last year, FIR stated.

161.title: Ferry firm that fired 800 workers on Zoom call can face unlimited fine: UK govt
161.article_body: UK Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng wrote to P&O Ferries, a shipping company that fired 800 employees over a three-minute Zoom call. Kwarteng said failure to give sufficient notice of large-scale redundancies, via the Insolvency Service and the Redundancy Payment Service, "is a criminal offence and can lead to an unlimited fine". Meanwhile, protests erupted against P&O Ferries across UK ports.

162.title: My first season in the IPL in 2019 with RCB was challenging: Hetmyer
162.article_body: Shimron Hetmyer admitted that IPL 2019 which marked his first season in the IPL, and saw him representing RCB was "challenging". "Being the only West Indian in the squad was tough," said Hetmyer. Hetmyer scored 90 runs in five matches in IPL 2019. He will represent RR in IPL 2022 having been signed for ₹8.50 crore in the mega auction.

163.title: Suzuki Motor to invest ₹9,569 cr for EV production in India: Report
163.article_body: Japan's Suzuki Motor plans to invest about ₹9,569 crore to produce electric vehicles and batteries in India, Reuters reported citing the Nikkei's report. Suzuki aims to build a new electric vehicle production line in India and start operations as early as 2025. Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is visiting India on Saturday to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

164.title: NDRF personnel deployed in Andaman and Nicobar ahead of Cyclone Asani
164.article_body: National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel have been deployed in Andaman and Nicobar Islands as IMD predicted Cyclone Asani over Bay of Bengal on March 21. According to the administration, NDRF personnel are ready at different places with all necessary equipment to carry out search and rescue operations. "Fishermen are strongly advised not to venture into sea," the administration tweeted.

165.title: Varun to team up with Atlee for Hindi remake of South film: Reports
165.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan and filmmaker Atlee are reportedly teaming up for the Hindi remake of a South film. "There's a good chance that the film may be Vijay and Samantha starrer 'Theri'," reports stated. The original, which was released in 2016, was also helmed by Atlee. Meanwhile, the filmmaker is currently working on a film with Shah Rukh Khan.

166.title: An honour to play for India: Jhulan on becoming 2nd woman to play 200 ODIs
166.article_body: After she became the second woman cricketer to play 200 ODIs, following India captain Mithali Raj, pacer Jhulan Goswami said it's been an honour to play for India. The 39-year-old achieved this feat in India's match against Australia on Saturday in 2022 Women's World Cup. "It's been a pleasure, whenever I've worn this jersey. It's always been special," Jhulan added.

167.title: Pune's APMC seizes mangoes falsely being sold as Ratnagiri Alphonso
167.article_body: Pune's Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC) has seized 42 boxes of mangoes being falsely sold as Alphonso mangoes from Ratnagiri by three wholesale dealers, an official said on Saturday. The seized mangoes had arrived from Karnataka, the official added. Alphonso mangoes from Karnataka are cheaper than the Ratnagiri Alphonso, a mango trader said.

168.title: Just imagine 14,000 dead bodies in that Russian stadium: Zelenskyy on Putin's speech
168.article_body: Commenting on Russian President Vladimir Putin's speech at a packed soccer stadium, Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Just picture for yourself that in that stadium in Moscow there are 14,000 dead bodies...Those are the Russian costs throughout the invasion." Zelenskyy warned that Russia will lose in the long run if it doesn't end its war.

169.title: Profile of the world's most boring person released by researchers in the UK
169.article_body: British researchers have revealed the profile of the world's most boring person, based on a study on 500 people. The study summed up that the world's most boring person would be a data entry worker who's religious, lives in a town and whose favourite hobby is watching TV. Data analysis, accounting are among the most boring jobs, the study said.

170.title: Baltic countries expel 10 Russian diplomats amid Ukraine war
170.article_body: Latvia, Estonia, and Lithuania have expelled a total of 10 Russian diplomats amid the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine, the foreign ministries of the three Baltic nations said. Lithuania has expelled four Russian diplomats, while Estonia and Latvia have expelled three each. "All ungrounded expulsions of Russian diplomats will be met with an appropriate answer," Russia's Foreign Ministry said.

171.title: Businessman to give away free gas worth $1 million as prices hit record high in US
171.article_body: US businessman Willie Wilson has announced that he would be giving away $1 million worth of gas free of cost to Cook County residents from March 24 as prices hit record high in the country. Earlier this week, several cars lined up at gas stations after he announced $200,000 worth of free gas at 10 stations in the city.

172.title: Elon Musk says first humans could land on Mars in 2029
172.article_body: SpaceX CEO in response to a Twitter user said the first humans could land on Mars in 2029. The user had posted a photo showing the 1969 Moon landing along with an image of people on Mars that read, "20_ _?" Last year, Musk had said, in a worst-case scenario, SpaceX would land humans on Mars in 10 years.

173.title: Organs of brain dead man give new lease of life to 6 patients in K'taka
173.article_body: Umesh B Dandagi (51), who was declared brain dead at KLES Hospital in Karnataka's Belagavi, gave new lease of life to six patients. His heart was transplanted to a patient in the same hospital. His kidneys were sent to their respective recipients through green corridor and liver was airlifted to Bengaluru. His corneas and skin were donated to respective banks.

174.title: Anushka Sharma steps away from her production house
