174.article_body: Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to announce she's stepping away from her production house Clean Slate Filmz (CSF) which she co-founded with her brother Karnesh. "Being a new mother who has chosen to be an actor by profession...I've decided...whatever time I've at hand...I'll dedicate it to my first love, acting!" she wrote. Clean Slate Filmz was founded in October 2013.

175.title: Camilla takes over Meghan Markle's former theatre patronage
175.article_body: Prince Charles' wife Camilla has taken over Meghan Markle's former theatre patronage. In a tweet, the National Theatre welcomed the Duchess of Cornwall as its Royal Patron. The move makes Camilla one of the first members of royal family to take up Meghan's former royal duties. Notably, National Theatre was among the four patronages passed on to Meghan in 2019.

176.title: 45-yr-old man thrashed to death after argument during Holi celebration
176.article_body: A 45-year-old man, Rajendra, was allegedly beaten to death on Friday following an argument during Holi celebration in Gurugram. After learning about his brother Sonu's clash with his brother-in-law Mithun, the deceased reportedly visited Mithun to sort the matter out where he was attacked with bricks and sticks. He was rushed to a hospital but doctors declared him brought dead.

177.title: Putin fired around 1,000 staff members fearing they would poison him: Report
177.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin allegedly fired about 1,000 personal staff members in February over fears that they would poison him, said a report. Citing a government source, the report said that those who were fired, included cooks, bodyguards, launderers, and secretaries. The report also said that in Russia, the preferred method of assassination is poisoning.

178.title: Every film has its own destiny: Pooja Hegde on mixed reviews for Radhe Shyam
178.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde while talking about receiving mixed reviews for her recently released film 'Radhe Shyam' said every film has its own destiny at the box office. "Sometimes you watch a film and you think it's an okay film but the box office does really well," she added. However, the actress said people praised her despite the film's overall performance.

179.title: 3 attack man with iron rod after he refused to give 'hafta' in Pune; held
179.article_body: Police have arrested three persons for attacking a man with an iron rod in Pune's Kondhwa. The victim alleged the accused told him that they were the goons of the area and he'll have to pay them regular protection money (hafta). However, when he rejected their demand, they attacked him and robbed him of his gold chain worth ₹1.05 lakh.

180.title: 72-yr-old auto-rickshaw driver held for molesting, kidnapping minor in Delhi
180.article_body: A 72-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was arrested for allegedly molesting and kidnapping an 11-year-old girl from Delhi's Bengali Market area on the Barakhamba Road. "The incident came to light on March 17 after the victim's parents...informed...their daughter had gone missing," police said. "The accused was trying to escape with the girl to Uttarakhand's Haridwar," police added.

181.title: 4,000 bikers penalised for not using a helmet on Holi in Mumbai
181.article_body: The Mumbai Police conducted a special drive on Holi and penalised 4,130 bikers for not using helmets. A total of 8,276 fines were issued from Thursday midnight to 7 pm on Friday. As per data, 1,876 fines were issued for violating parking norms, 110 were penalised for wrong side driving and 199 abandoned vehicles were cleared.

182.title: MI miscalculated, they'll surely miss Boult: Rajkumar ahead of IPL 2022
182.article_body: Rajkumar Sharma, childhood coach of Virat Kohli, said MI will miss pacer Trent Boult in upcoming IPL 2022 as he wasn't retained by them in mega auction last month. He added that the Mumbai-based franchise "miscalculated" before the auction. "To make up for Boult's absence, they went for Jaydev Unadkat," Rajkumar added. Boult was bought by RR for ₹8 crore.

183.title: Will hold protests if railway concessions for senior citizens not restored: Pune Cong
183.article_body: Congress' Pune unit has warned the Centre that it will hold protests if concessions for senior citizens on railway tickets are not restored. Congress spokesperson Gopal Tiwari said concession helps senior citizens "in religious journeys and to visit other places". Tiwari added, "We condemn the decision of the Central government."

184.title: Ethereum's billionaire co-founder shares tweets trolling him for TIME cover
184.article_body: Vitalik Buterin, who co-founded the world's second-largest cryptocurrency Ethereum, on Saturday shared screenshots of tweets trolling him for his TIME magazine cover. The billionaire said, "The...tweets...are truly amazing. These are barely even cherry-picked...Highly recommend scrolling." The 28-year-old Russia-born Canadian is among the most influential people in the cryptocurrency world.

185.title: Hopeful CRPF won't be required soon in Northeast, J&K and Naxal-hit areas: Shah
185.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said he is hopeful that soon Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) won't be required in the Northeast, Jammu and Kashmir and Naxal-affected areas in the coming years. Shah added that the CRPF has played an indispensable role in maintaining internal security in these areas. Shah was addressing CRPF's 83rd Raising Day parade in Jammu.

186.title: Dalit man killed over his 'good looks, moustache', says family; Rajasthan police deny
186.article_body: The family of a Dalit man named Jitendrapal Meghwal, who was living in Rajasthan's Pali district, has alleged that he was killed because the accused were jealous of his moustache and good looks. While accused Suraj and Ramesh Singh have been arrested, police said the murder wasn't related to victim's looks but a mutual rivalry related to an old case.

187.title: People crushed by price rise; inflation a tax on all: Rahul Gandhi
187.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the BJP-led Centre by tweeting that India's poor and middle-class were crushed by the "record price rise" even before the Ukraine war. Gandhi also added that "Inflation is a TAX on ALL Indians...GOI must act now" to protect the Indian citizens. His criticism comes days after Congress' debacle in the recent assembly elections.

188.title: Prostitution racket busted at OYO hotel in Delhi; 3 Uzbek women held
188.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday busted an international prostitution racket and arrested six people from an OYO hotel in Pandav Nagar, police said. After receiving information about the prostitution racket being run at the hotel, police carried out a raid on the hotel and arrested the accused, including three women from Uzbekistan. Police have now registered a case into the matter.

189.title: Morality is something: BJP on NCP not seeking Malik's resignation
189.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Kripashankar Singh has criticised NCP for not seeking the resignation of Minority Development Minister Nawab Malik. The BJP leader said, "Morality is something. It's a shame if a present minister... is in jail." He added that Malik's resignation should be taken for now and if the court finds him innocent then "he could be made minister again".

190.title: Pune-Solapur flyover likely to reopen tomorrow, to ease traffic congestion
190.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has planned to reopen the Pune-Solapur flyover at Hadapsar from tomorrow, easing traffic congestion. The flyover would resume traffic on one lane, Pune towards Solapur, for light-weight vehicles, however, heavy vehicles will be allowed after a month. The flyover was shut in February after local representatives complained of damage to a portion of the flyover.

191.title: 13-yr-old, mother die as SUV hits auto in Delhi; 21-yr-old driver held
191.article_body: Four of a family were severely injured, of whom a 13-year-boy and his mother died, after an SUV, being driven by a 21-year-old third-year college student, hit an auto-rickshaw on the Barapullah flyover on Friday. After hitting the auto-rickshaw, the accused also hit another car. Police said the accused has been arrested and an investigation is underway.

192.title: Morris Chestnut to be honoured with a star on Hollywood Walk of Fame
192.article_body: Morris Chestnut, who starred in 'Anacondas: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid', will be honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The 53-year-old actor will be the 2,716th celebrity to receive a star on the walkway. "We're proud to welcome him to our famed Walk of Fame," said Ana Martinez, Producer of the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

193.title: Krunal will be laughing at me: Hardik on facing LSG in GT's IPL 2022 opener
193.article_body: GT skipper Hardik Pandya said his brother and LSG all-rounder Krunal Pandya will be "laughing" at him when he walks out for his first toss, in GT's IPL 2022 opener against LSG. "Krunal...has never seen me [go for the toss]," added Hardik, revealing the reason behind his brother's reaction. GT will take on LSG on March 28 at Wankhede Stadium.

194.title: Universal Music label acquires Bored Ape NFT for $360,817
194.article_body: Universal Music Group has bought one of the Bored Apes NFTs for $360,817. The group has purchased Bored Ape #5537, a female character now known as Manager Noët All, which will lead its virtual NFT band, called Kingship, as the manager. Prior to the new joining, Kingship consisted of four digital characters, one mutant ape and three bored ape NFTs.

195.title: Don Young, longest-serving US congressman, passes away at 88
195.article_body: US Republican Representative Don Young, who was the longest-serving member of Congress, passed away at the age of 88 on Friday. The congressman died while travelling home to Alaska, his office said in a statement. "Don Young's legacy as a fighter for the state will live on, as will his fundamental goodness and honour. We'll miss him dearly," it added.

196.title: Which states have the highest active COVID-19 cases in India?
196.article_body: India currently has 27,802 active COVID-19 cases, with 15 states/UTs currently having more than 500 active COVID-19 cases. Kerala has the highest active COVID-19 cases at 7,289, followed by Maharashtra (5,684) and Mizoram (2,127). Karnataka has 2,055 active COVID-19 cases, while Assam and West Bengal also have more than 1,000 active COVID-19 cases.

197.title: Ukrainian bridal gown brand is now making military nets, vests for soldiers
197.article_body: A Ukrainian brand known for its wedding gowns is now also producing military nets and assault vests for the country's soldiers and medical workers amid the war with Russia. "Along with making brides around the globe happy, we are focused on saving our country," said Milla Nova's CEO Ulyana Kyrychuk. The CEO said they have already made 1,500 items.

198.title: TCS reappoints Rajesh Gopinathan as CEO and MD for five years
198.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has reappointed Rajesh Gopinathan as its Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Managing Director (MD) for five years. The company's board has also extended the term of Ganapathy Subramaniam as Chief Operating Officer and Executive Director to May 2024, as per its retirement age policy. Both Gopinathan and Subramaniam have held their respective positions since 2017.

199.title: Great Barrier Reef suffers severe coral bleaching due to high temperature
199.article_body: According to the Australian government agency, the Great Barrier Reef is suffering widespread and severe coral bleaching due to high ocean temperatures. "Bleaching has been detected across the Marine Park - it's widespread but variable, across multiple regions, ranging in impact from minor to severe," the authority added. The bleaching that occurred two years back damaged two-thirds of the coral.

200.title: 4-yr UG programmes to start at Pune university from academic year 2022-23
200.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) is going to introduce four-year undergraduate programmes from the academic year 2022-23. The University Grants Commission (UGC) had released draft guidelines on four-year UG programmes, which was proposed in the National Education Policy. SPPU VC said the new programme will help students in research and further studies, while also pursuing a PhD.

201.title: Demonising Kashmiri Muslims doesn't help Kashmiri Pandits: Tharoor
201.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Saturday, while sharing a Facebook post about Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Kashmir Files' on Twitter, said, "Kashmiri Pandits suffered terribly...But demonising Kashmiri Muslims doesn't help the Pandits either." "Hatred divides and kills. Kashmiris need justice. All need to be heard, helped and healed," Tharoor added.

202.title: Russia to work on its own Mars mission after Europe suspends project: Report
202.article_body: Russia will start working on its own Mars mission after Europe's ESA announced the suspension of a joint project following the Ukraine invasion, the Interfax news agency reported. The ESA had said it would be impossible to continue cooperating with Russia on the ExoMars mission. Roscosmos head said there were "big doubts" about what the ESA could do without Russia.

203.title: Smoke from wildfires destroys ozone layer: Study
203.article_body: Smoke from wildfires can destroy the ozone layer, a study by the University of Waterloo has found. "The Australian fires injected acidic smoke particles into the stratosphere, disrupting the chlorine, hydrogen and nitrogen chemistry that regulate ozone," the lead author of the study said. The smoke converts these ozone-regulating compounds into more reactive compounds that destroy ozone, he added.

204.title: Australia record highest successful chase in Women's World Cup history, defeat India
204.article_body: Australia chased down a 278-run target against India on Saturday to record the highest successful run chase in Women's World Cup history. The previous highest successful run chase in Women's World Cups had come in 2017, when Australia chased down a 258-run target against Sri Lanka. Australia have won each of their five 2022 Women's World Cup matches so far.

205.title: Ukraine temporarily lost access to Sea of Azov: Defence Ministry
205.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry said it had "temporarily" lost access to the Sea of Azov. The ministry didn't specify whether Ukraine had regained access to the sea, but said that Russian forces had been pushed back from approaches toward the southern city of Mykolaiv. Russia on Friday had said it was "tightening the noose" around the besieged port city of Mariupol.

206.title: Won't see a young player as good as Shaw in my life: PBKS batting consultant
206.article_body: Sharing his experience on watching Prithvi Shaw bat when he was eight years old, PBKS' batting consultant Julian Wood said he will never see a young player as good as Shaw again in his life. "I have never seen a boy that young technically so sound," added Wood. "He hit the ball very hard for someone so small," stated Wood.

207.title: Satellite pics show destruction in Ukraine's Mariupol after Russian bombing
207.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share satellite pictures showing destruction in Ukraine's Mariupol after Russian attack. "This is Mariupol, showing devastation to residential homes, apartment buildings and stores in north and west of the port city in Ukraine," it wrote. Russia also destroyed a theatre sheltering civilians in the city.

208.title: England in danger for too much reliance on Root, Stokes: Nick Compton
208.article_body: Ex-England batter Nick Compton said England have been in danger for being too reliant on Joe Root and Ben Stokes for a while. Root and Stokes scored 153 and 120 respectively in the first innings of England's Barbados Test against West Indies. Dan Lawrence was the next top run-getter with 91 runs as England declared having scored 507 runs.

209.title: Taliban frees journalists detained over report on TV show censoring
209.article_body: The Taliban have released three employees of Afghanistan's largest television station, TOLONews, for allegedly reporting on the Taliban government's decision to ban the broadcast of foreign TV series in the country. The UN and press freedom organisations had condemned the journalists' arrest. Reportedly, over 230 media outlets have shut down in Afghanistan since the Taliban seized power in August.

210.title: Russia uses Kinzhal hypersonic missiles in Ukraine
210.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry has said that the country used hypersonic Kinzhal missiles in Ukraine, according to an Interfax report. "The Kinzhal aviation missile system with hypersonic aeroballistic missiles destroyed a large underground warehouse containing missiles and aviation ammunition in the village of Deliatyn in the Ivano-Frankivsk region," the ministry added.

211.title: 'The Kashmir Files' earns ₹19.15 cr on day 8, more than Aamir Khan's 'Dangal'
211.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' has crossed the ₹100 crore mark in India. According to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri directorial earned more money on day eight than Aamir Khan's 'Dangal'. "#TheKashmirFiles creates history. Day 8 of The Kashmir Files [₹19.15 cr] is AT PAR with #Baahubali2 [₹19.75 cr] and higher than #Dangal [₹18.59 cr]," he tweeted.

212.title: 'The Batman' actor Paul Dano to write comic book about Riddler
212.article_body: Actor Paul Dano, who played The Riddler in Robert Pattinson-starrer 'The Batman', is writing a comic exploring the origins of the supervillain. Titled 'Riddler: Year One', the comic will launch in stores in October, DC shared on Twitter. 'The Batman', directed by Matt Reeves, has earned more than $500 million at the worldwide box office.

213.title: It's a sweet story: Shreyas on his next directorial 'Sar Car Ki Seva Mei'
213.article_body: Shreyas Talpade, who's currently working on his second directorial, tentatively titled 'Sar Car Ki Seva Mei', spoke about the upcoming film in an interview. Describing the film as a "sweet little story", he said it's about a man whose car gets stolen and what he does to get it back. "I play that part...and direct it as well," Shreyas said.

214.title: Hyderabad City Police arrest 11 people for gambling
214.article_body: Hyderabad's Trimulgherry Police on Friday arrested 11 people for gambling. Acting on a tip-off, the police raided a house in Saraswathi Nagar and arrested the accused. The police also seized ₹11,600 cash, 10 cell phones and playing cards from the accused. According to police, prime accused S Satyanarayana had been previously involved in similar offences in the city.

215.title: Cong names Ripun Bora, Jeby Mather as RS candidates from Assam, Kerala
215.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Ripun Bora and Kerala Pradesh Mahila Congress President Jeby Mather have been named as the Congress candidates for the biennial elections to Rajya Sabha from Assam and Kerala respectively. Bora was first elected to the Upper House in March 2016 while Mather has never been elected yet. The candidatures were approved by Congress President Sonia Gandhi.

216.title: 65-yr-old man killed in Guj as two groups clash over playing cricket match
216.article_body: A 65-year-old man was killed when two communities clashed over playing a cricket match in  Sandalpur village of Gujarat's Navsari district. The incident occurred on Friday after an argument broke out between the groups and people attacked each other with deadly weapons. According to Navsari DSP, a case was registered against 32 people following cross FIRs from both sides.

217.title: Google accused of systemic bias against Black employees
217.article_body: Google has been accused of systemic racial bias against Black employees, claiming it drives them towards lower-level jobs, pays them less and denies them opportunities. The lawsuit said Google maintains a "racially biased corporate culture" that favours white men, with Black people comprising only 4.4% of employees. It allegedly also subjected Black employees to a hostile work environment.

218.title: Indrani Mukerjea gets bail in 2017 Byculla jail rioting case
218.article_body: Former media executive Indrani Mukerjea has been granted bail in connection to a case lodged following rioting in Byculla jail in 2017. The accused, including Indrani and over 30 inmates, had caused damage to prison property as well as injured six prison guards during the rioting. Indrani is also accused of killing her daughter Sheena Bora in 2012.

219.title: Infant killed, 3 injured as SUV with TRS MLA's sticker hits street vendors in Hyd
219.article_body: A two-month-old child died and three others were injured when a speeding SUV, with a temporary registration number, hit street vendors in Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills. The vehicle had a sticker in the name of Bodhan TRS MLA Mohammed Shakil Aamir. Aamir has reportedly claimed that he had nothing to do with the incident and that it was his cousin's vehicle.

220.title: Ex-US Presidents visit Ukrainian Church to show support for Kyiv
220.article_body: Ex-US Presidents Bill Clinton and George W Bush visited a Ukrainian church in Chicago in a show of solidarity for the country amid Russian invasion. They laid sunflowers wrapped with blue and yellow ribbons at the Saints Volodymyr and Olha Catholic Church. "America stands united with the people of Ukraine in their fight for freedom and against oppression," Clinton said.

221.title: TN to allot ₹1,000 to girls in govt schools monthly to pursue higher education
221.article_body: Tamil Nadu government will provide ₹1,000 monthly assistance to all girl students studying in classes 6 to 12 in government schools to encourage them to pursue higher education. The amount will be transferred into their bank accounts till completion of their undergraduate degree, diploma and ITI courses. The scheme will benefit approximately six lakh girls in the state, government said.

222.title: Priyanka, Nick share pics and videos from Holi bash at their LA home
222.article_body: Priyanka Chopra and her husband Nick Jonas have shared pictures and videos from the Holi bash at their home in Los Angeles. Nick's brother Kevin Jonas and youngest sibling Franklin Jonas also joined them for the party. "Thank you to our friends and family for playing holi like desi's do! Feeling blessed," Priyanka wrote on Instagram.

223.title: Amit Shah attends CRPF's 83rd Raising Day parade in Jammu, presents awards
223.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah attended CRPF's 83rd Raising Day parade in Jammu on Saturday. Shah also presented awards and medals to CRPF personnel and families of soldiers who lost their lives while fighting terrorism and insurgency across the country. Notably, this is the first time that CRPF is celebrating the event outside the national capital.

224.title: My wife refused to come for 2011 WC final, she still gets embarrassed about it: Gambhir
224.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir has revealed that his wife Natasha refused to come for the 2011 World Cup final in Mumbai. "She said 'Is it that important? It's just another game of cricket. Who will bother travelling to Mumbai? My sister and brother will come'," Gambhir said. Gambhir further said that she still gets embarrassed about rejecting the offer.

225.title: Boy who escaped Ukraine with phone number written on hand reunites with mother
225.article_body: An 11-year-old Ukrainian boy, who travelled 1,000 km alone to reach Slovakia amid the war, has been reunited with his mother. Hassan Pisecká escaped Ukraine with only a plastic bag, passport, and telephone number scribbled on his hand. "I'd like to thank everyone from my heart. We lost everything we've had but we're healthy," his mother said.

226.title: Brazil blocks Telegram over non-compliance, CEO apologises
226.article_body: Brazilian Supreme Court has ordered the suspension of Telegram for failing to freeze accounts spreading disinformation or comply with the country's laws. Telegram CEO Pavel Durov apologized for the company's "negligence" and asked the court to delay its ruling for a few days. Apple and Google have been asked to help block their users from being able to use Telegram.

227.title: It will take years to defuse unexploded Russian mines: Ukraine
227.article_body: Ukrainian Interior Minister Denys Monastyrsky said that it'll "take years" to defuse unexploded Russian shells and mines. Ukraine will need support from the West to cope with the task once the war is over, he added. In addition to the unexploded Russian ordnances, Ukrainian forces have planted land mines at bridges, airports, and other key infrastructure to deter Russian use.

228.title: Man shot dead by neighbour during Holi celebrations in Kolkata
228.article_body: A man, identified as Dilip Chauhan, was shot dead by his neighbour during Holi celebrations following a heated argument in Kolkata, police said. The deceased was a peanut seller and accused used to work in a fish market, police added. "Around 3:00 pm we heard the sound of gunfire...We found that Chauhan had been shot," a local resident said.

229.title: Mumbai woman constable's husband shares obscene pics of her online, held
229.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for allegedly circulating obscene pictures of his 27-year-old wife, who is a woman police constable in Mumbai, on social media, police said. A police officer at the Marine Drive police station said the accused, who lives in Pune, had a dispute with his wife, which could be the reason why he circulated the photographs online.

230.title: Police arrest 2 men for stealing scooters in Thane
230.article_body: Police have arrested two persons in Thane on Friday for allegedly stealing scooters in the city. Based on a tip-off, police laid a trap for the accused who were coming to Shastri Nagar to sell the stolen scooters at half of their price. Seven scooters stolen between 2018 and 2021 were also recovered from them.

231.title: Sunny Deol celebrates Holi on sets of 'Gadar 2', shares video
231.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol on Friday celebrated Holi with the cast and crew of his film, 'Gadar 2'. Taking to Instagram, he shared a video where he can be seen applying gulal to the film's director Anil Sharma and his son, actor Utkarsh Sharma. "#HappyHoli everyone," Sunny wrote. Utkarsh will play the role of Sunny's son in the upcoming film.

232.title: 2 drown while taking bath in Odisha river after celebrating Holi; 4 others missing
232.article_body: Two youths drowned and four others went missing while bathing in Kharasrota river in a village in Odisha's Jajpur, officials said. Seven youths had gone to the river to take a bath after celebrating Holi when they were swept away in the strong current of the river, the village sarpanch said. One of them was rescued and rushed to hospital.

233.title: Raina is a legend but was perhaps not suited for IPL 2022: RR's Sangakkara
233.article_body: RR's Director of Cricket Kumar Sangakkara said Suresh Raina is an "absolute legend" but was perhaps "not suited" for the upcoming IPL 2022, having gone unsold in IPL mega auction. Raina has scored 5,528 runs in 205 IPL matches so far having represented CSK and now-defunct franchise Gujarat Lions. He scored 160 runs in 12 IPL 2021 matches for CSK.

234.title: 10 MLAs sworn-in as ministers in Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's Cabinet
234.article_body: Ten MLAs were sworn-in as ministers in Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's Cabinet after they took oath on Saturday at Raj Bhavan in Chandigarh. The ceremony began with Harpal Singh Cheema, a second time MLA from Dirba, taking the oath. Aam Aadmi Party announced Kultar Singh Sandhwan, a two-time MLA from Kotkapura, as the Speaker of the 16th Punjab Vidhan Sabha.

235.title: 3 Russian cosmonauts wear colours of Ukrainian flag as they arrive on space station
235.article_body: Three Russian cosmonauts arrived at the International Space Station (ISS) wearing yellow flight suits with blue accents, colours that match the flag of Ukraine. “It became our turn to pick a colour. But, in fact, we had accumulated a lot of yellow material so we needed to use it," one of the cosmonauts said about the colour of their suits.

236.title: Will donate his body for research: Father of Indian student killed in Ukraine
236.article_body: The father of Indian student Naveen Shekarappa Gyanagoudar who was killed in the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv has decided to donate his son's body for medical research. "My son wanted to achieve something in the medical field, that didn't happen. At least his body can be used by other medical students for studies," his father added.

237.title: 8 killed, over 25 injured as private bus overturns in Karnataka
237.article_body: At least eight persons died after the private bus they were travelling in overturned in the Tumakuru district of Karnataka on Saturday. Police said that more than 25 persons sustained injuries in the accident. Initial investigations suggest that the bus, which was carrying 60 passengers, toppled after the driver lost control over the vehicle, police added.

238.title: Biden talks to China's Xi for nearly 2 hours as they discuss Ukraine war
238.article_body: US President Joe Biden talked to Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping for nearly two hours as the leaders discussed the war in Ukraine. Xi said China and US should "shoulder international responsibilities". The White House said, "President Biden described the implications and consequences if China provides material support to Russia as it conducts brutal attacks against Ukrainian cities and civilians."

239.title: Zostel could be entitled to 7% stake in IPO-bound OYO: HC bench
239.article_body: A Delhi High Court division bench has said Zostel will be entitled to 7% stake in IPO-bound OYO, if it eventually wins its claim, or be paid the value of its shareholding. As per the order, the two parties are also open to a consensual order. Zostel has been engaged in a court battle with OYO over a failed merger.

240.title: Elgar Parishad accused activist alleges tampering with COVID certificate
240.article_body: Activist Arun Ferreira, an Elgar Parishad case accused, alleged his COVID-19 vaccination certificate was tampered with and sought a probe into the same. He claimed that the certificate given to him was different from the one accessed by his family. The applicant's name, age and other details were incorrectly mentioned in the certificate provided by the prison, Ferreira's plea states.

241.title: BMC to add over 100 COVID-19 vaccination centres for 12-15 age group
241.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will increase the number of COVID-19 vaccination centres from 12 to 100-150 for children aged between 12-15 years. According to BMC, there are around four lakh children within the age group. However, there has been a low turnout in the vaccination due to the exam season, a BMC official said.

242.title: Youth beaten, booked for allegedly propagating Christianity in Karnataka
242.article_body: A youth was beaten up by right-wing activists for allegedly propagating Christianity outside a college in Hassan, Karnataka. A right-wing outfit, Bajarangi Hindu Parishat, lodged a police complaint that booked him and his wife under section 295 A of the IPC for outraging religious feelings. The outfit accused youth of luring college students to embrace the Christian faith.

243.title: Syrian Prez visits UAE, 1st trip to Arab state since war began in 2011
243.article_body: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad arrived in the UAE on Friday, his first trip to an Arab state since the Syrian war began in 2011. Assad met Abu Dhabi Crown Prince Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, who expressed willingness to strengthen ties with Syria again, Emirati state media reported. The Arab League had expelled Syria after the war broke out.

244.title: Man stabs self to death while dancing at Holika Dahan celebrations in MP
244.article_body: A man succumbed to knife injuries while celebrating Holika Dahan in the Banganga area of Madhya Pradesh, according to police. The incident took place when the man was dancing, along with other people, with a knife in his hand. The man allegedly stabbed himself, police said, adding that a case has been registered in this connection.

245.title: Man dies after falling from building while fighting over drugs in Mumbai
245.article_body: A 19-year-old man died after falling from the fourth floor of a building in Mumbai. According to police, victim Aftab Shaikh was consuming drugs with Sultan Khan on the terrace of a building in Kurla. However, both fell while fighting after Khan accused Shaikh of consuming more marijuana. The victim died on spot while Khan suffered minor injuries.

246.title: Sanjay & I are shocked beyond words: Torbaaz producer on Girish's son's death
246.article_body: Rahul Mittra, who bankrolled Girish Malik's directorial 'Torbaaz', has condoled the demise of Girish's son Mannan, who passed away after falling from the fifth floor of his building in Mumbai's Andheri on Friday. "I am non-plussed to learn about the unfortunate incident," he said. Rahul added that Sanjay Dutt is "deeply saddened too". "We are shocked beyond words," Rahul said.

247.title: Catholic body urges Guj CM to include all holy books in school curriculum
247.article_body: The Gujarat Education Board of Catholic Institutions (GEBCI) has written to Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel, requesting the state government to include the principles of all holy books in the school curriculum. This comes after the state government announced on Thursday that Bhagavad Gita will be a part of the school syllabus for classes 6-12 from the academic year 2022-23.

248.title: Glenn Maxwell marries his Indian fiancée Vini Raman, shares pic
248.article_body: Australian cricketer Glenn Maxwell got married to his Indian fiancée Vini Raman, who is a Melbourne-based pharmacist. The couple took to Instagram to share a picture from their Christian wedding ceremony, writing, "Mr and Mrs Maxwell 18.03.22." They had been dating for around four years. On March 27, the couple will get married in a traditional ceremony with Tamil-Brahmin customs.

249.title: Mithali Raj equals record for registering most 50-plus scores in Women's World Cups
249.article_body: India captain Mithali Raj has equalled the record for registering most 50-plus scores in Women's World Cups. Mithali scored 68 runs off 96 deliveries against Australia today, which is her 12th 50-plus score in Women's World Cups. She equalled the record of former New Zealand cricketer Debbie Hockley. Notably, Mithali is featuring in her sixth Women's World Cup.

250.title: Viral pic shows 'Grandson of MLA' written on number plate of man's bike in TN
250.article_body: A viral picture shows 'Grandson of Nagercoil MLA Shri MR Gandhi' written on the number plate of a man's bike in Tamil Nadu. Several social media users criticised the man, with many saying that Gandhi, who is a senior BJP leader, is unmarried. Users also said that Gandhi is a simple man who goes to the state Assembly without footwear.

251.title: NSG head constable dies by suicide in Haryana’s Manesar: Police
251.article_body: A head constable of the National Security Guard (NSG) allegedly died by suicide at the NSG camp in Haryana's Manesar on Friday, police said. The reason that led the deceased to take such an extreme step is, however, not yet certain. His wife is in a state of shock and is being treated in a hospital, police added.

252.title: India's Pooja Vastrakar smashes the biggest six of 2022 Women's World Cup so far
252.article_body: India's Pooja Vastrakar smashed the biggest six of 2022 Women's World Cup after hitting an 81-metre maximum on the bowling of Australia's Megan Schutt on Saturday. She overtook South Africa's Chloe Tryon and compatriot Smriti Mandhana, who had slammed 80-metre sixes. Vastrakar scored 34 runs off 28 deliveries against Australia.

253.title: Man killed after fight at shop near PVR Naraina in Delhi, 5 apprehended
253.article_body: Five people were apprehended for allegedly killing a man following a heated argument at a paan shop near PVR Naraina on Friday night, Delhi Police said. The victim was a 27-year-old man who was a resident of Naraina. A fight broke out after the vehicle of the deceased hit an employee of the paan shop, police added.

254.title: Kapil Sharma's fan shares his look from Nandita Das' film, he reacts
254.article_body: A fan of Kapil Sharma shared a picture of the comedian-actor on Twitter, revealing his look from Nandita Das' film. In the picture, he can be seen carrying a delivery bag on his back. "Today I saw you in person," the fan wrote. Kapil, who'll portray a food delivery rider in the film, responded, "Don't tell anyone else about it."

255.title: Kerala HC acquits ex-minister MM Mani in Anchery Baby murder case
255.article_body: Kerala High Court on Friday acquitted former Kerala Minister and CPI(M) leader MM Mani and two others accused in the Anchery Baby murder case. Anchery Baby, a Youth Congress leader, was shot dead on November 13, 1982, in Idukki. The case was reopened after Mani had said in May 2012 that three persons who had opposed the party were killed.

256.title: Google's undersea cable lands in Togo, to 'double' internet speed
256.article_body: A Google-owned subsea cable, the Equiano cable, that aims to "double" the internet speed for millions in Africa arrived in Togo on Friday. It will also make landings in Nigeria, Namibia and South Africa, with possible branches offering connections to nearby countries. It is expected to start operating by the end of the year.

257.title: 17-yr-old drowns after slipping into 25-ft pond while taking selfie in Gurugram
257.article_body: A 17-year-old boy drowned while trying to take a selfie by standing at the edge of a 25-foot-deep pond in Gurugram. Police said the boy and his two friends posed for a selfie after forming a chain by holding hands. After two of them slipped and fell, the third person jumped into water and managed to save one of them.

258.title: US military plane with 4 onboard crashes during NATO exercise
258.article_body: A US military plane with four people onboard crashed in northern Norway while taking part in the North Atlantic Treaty Organisation (NATO) drills, Norwegian officials said. Reportedly, the Marine MV-22 Osprey, belonging to the US Marine Corps, lost contact with ground support due to bad weather. Currently, there are about 3,000 US Marines in Norway for a NATO training exercise.

259.title: India reports 2,075 COVID-19 cases, 71 deaths in last 24 hours
259.article_body: India has reported 2,075 new COVID-19 cases, 3,383 recoveries, and 71 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 2,528 cases and 149 deaths. The COVID-19 death toll in the country has risen to 5,16,352, while the active caseload declined to 27,802.

260.title: 4 workers from Bengal killed, 1 missing as land caves in at Kerala construction site
260.article_body: Four workers from West Bengal died, two sustained injuries and another went missing after the land caved in at a construction site inside Electronic City in Kerala's Kochi, police said. The incident took place when they were digging land to lay pillars. Some local residents claimed that work was going on without local body's permission and without enough safety measures.

261.title: 23-yr-old who went to take bath in U'khand's Bhagirathi river goes missing
261.article_body: A 23-year-old man, who went to take bath in the Bhagirathi river with his friends after Holi celebrations on Friday in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi has gone missing. The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) team along with State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) launched a rescue operation to locate the youth, but no trace of him was found until late evening.

262.title: Drunken man attacks traffic constable with stone in Thane; arrested
262.article_body: An on-duty traffic constable was attacked with stone by drunken men at Kapurbawdi in Thane. The 56-year-old constable had levied a fine on a bike rider in a drink-and-drive case on Friday evening. His pillion rider returned after 15 minutes to take revenge from the constable and attacked him with a big stone. He has been arrested.

263.title: LG suspends all shipments to Russia amid war with Ukraine
263.article_body: South Korean multinational conglomerate LG Electronics has announced that it's suspending all shipments to Russia amid its invasion of Ukraine. LG added that it will continue to keep a close watch on the situation as it unfolds. "We are deeply concerned for the health and safety of all people, and LG remains committed to supporting humanitarian relief efforts," LG stated.

264.title: Putin's speech justifying Ukraine invasion cut midway due to technical glitch
264.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin justified the invasion of Ukraine before a packed soccer stadium on Friday. The coverage of his speech on state television was unexpectedly interrupted by what Russia said was a technical problem with a server. Soon afterwards, Putin's speech, which lasted about five minutes, was re-aired from the start.

265.title: It is b******t, it is crap: Gambhir on people thinking he doesn't like MS Dhoni
265.article_body: On being asked about people thinking he doesn't like MS Dhoni, Gautam Gambhir said, "It's b******t. It's crap." "I've so much of mutual respect for him," he added. He further said, "I hope he's never in need...but if he's ever in need in life...I'll be the first one standing next to him because of what he's done for Indian cricket."

266.title: 22-year-old man murdered by lover's family in Pune, four arrested
266.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly killed by the family members of his lover in Pune. Four people have been arrested till now and the initial investigation reveals that the girl's family was against the affair between the two, police said. "Pradhunya Kamble was murdered...on Wednesday in Dangat Patil Industrial Estate," Shankar Khatke, inspector at the Warje Police Station, said.

267.title: China reports first COVID-19 deaths in more than a year
267.article_body: China's national health authorities reported two COVID-19 deaths on Saturday, the first recorded rise in the death toll since January 2021. The deaths were reported from Jilin province, which has instituted a travel ban, with people needing permission from police to travel across borders. China reported 2,157 new COVID-19 cases from community transmission on Saturday, with the majority in Jilin.

268.title: India backs ban on biological weapons at UN Security Council
268.article_body: At the UN Security Council, India backed a convention prohibiting biological weapons. "India attaches high importance to Biological and Toxin Weapons Convention as a key global and non-discriminatory disarmament Convention," India's Deputy Permanent Representative to the UN Ambassador R Ravindra said. He added it's important to ensure effective implementation of the BTWC in letter and spirit.

269.title: Tamil Nadu govt to bear cost of govt school students who get into IITs, IIMs
269.article_body: While presenting Budget 2022-23, Tamil Nadu Finance Minister P Thiaga Rajan announced the state government will bear the cost of undergraduate education of students who get into IITs, IIMs and other premier institutions. Those who studied in government schools from classes 6-12 will be eligible. Rajan proposed a monthly stipend of ₹1,000 for government school girl students pursuing higher studies.

270.title: Feeder bus service at metro stations in Pune to begin from March 21
270.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) is going to start feeder bus service at metro stations in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad from March 21. "Initially, we have kept 20 rounds of frequency daily. Depending on the response, we will increase the frequency," PMPML Traffic Manager said. "The routes are around 8-10 kilometres as per passengers' demands," he added.

271.title: Improper handling of Taiwan issues will hit China-US ties: Xi to Biden
271.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping told US President Joe Biden on Friday, "If the Taiwan issue is not handled properly, it'll have a subversive impact on the relationship between the two countries." "Some individuals in...US are sending...wrong signals to pro-independence forces in Taiwan, and that's very dangerous," Xi told Biden on a video call. China claims Taiwan as its own territory.

272.title: Lock Upp's Sara Khan reveals ex-husband cheated on her with a spa worker
272.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Sara Khan revealed that her ex-husband, Ali Mercchant, cheated on her with a woman who used to work at her spa in Mumbai. "I'd a spa...He was also involved in it...There was this assistant manager he appointed...I got to know about them...That's when I thought, with my workers? This is extreme...I thought that was it," she added.

273.title: Rachakonda Police arrest man for blackmailing woman with bathing video
273.article_body: The Rachakonda Police arrested a 21-year-old man for allegedly blackmailing and harassing a woman on social media. According to police, the accused, a resident of Kataram village in Bhupalpally district, is a close relative of the victim. However, he allegedly recorded a video of the victim while bathing and used it to seek sexual favours from her, police said.

274.title: 19-yr-old's body found in pond in Gurugram, friends booked for murder
274.article_body: A 19-year-old man's body was found in a pond in Gurugram's Palra village on Friday morning. Police have booked at least eight men, including the victim's friends, on charges of murder after his father's complaint. The incident took place when the victim had gone to a percolation pond for a bath with a group of friends, police said.

275.title: Biden nominates Indian-American Puneet Talwar as US envoy to Morocco
275.article_body: US President Joe Biden has nominated Indian-American Puneet Talwar to serve as Ambassador to Morocco, the White House announced on Friday. "Talwar has held senior national security and foreign policy positions in the State Department, White House, and the United States Senate," the White House said. He is currently a Senior Advisor at the US State Department.

276.title: GM buys SoftBank's stake in self-driving unit Cruise for $2.1 bn
276.article_body: General Motors has agreed to buy SoftBank Vision Fund 1's stake in its self-driving startup Cruise for $2.1 billion. It will also make a separate $1.35 billion investment in the unit that SoftBank had committed to make in 2018. The transactions will push GM's total ownership in the unit to 80%. Other remaining shareholders in Cruise include Microsoft and Honda.

277.title: Dog kennel, motor transport office inaugurated at Hyderabad CAR HQ
277.article_body: A dog kennel and a motor transport office were inaugurated at the City Armed Reserve (CAR) headquarters in Hyderabad's Amberpet on Thursday. A number of refresher courses were also organised for the personnel as part of the 15-day demobilisation camp. Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat who inaugurated the facilities lauded the services of the teams as "highly commendable".

278.title: I was struck in the head by a man, this s**t needs to stop: Actress Karen Fukuhara
278.article_body: Actress Karen Fukuhara, best known for playing Kimiko Miyashiro in 'The Boys' and Katana in 'Suicide Squad', took to Instagram to reveal that she "was struck in the head by a man". She accompanied the post with the hashtag "Stop Asian Hate". "This s**t needs to stop. Us women, Asians, the elderly need your help," she wrote.

279.title: Bangladesh win an ODI in South Africa for the first time in history
279.article_body: Bangladesh defeated South Africa by 38 runs in Centurion to register their first-ever ODI victory on South African soil. Prior to the match, Bangladesh had played 14 ODIs in South Africa, out of which they had lost 13, while one match had produced no result. Bangladesh scored 314/7 in the match, their highest-ever ODI total in South Africa.

280.title: 8-yr-old playing Holi on road dies, 3 injured after being hit by car in Mumbai
280.article_body: The driver of a private cab hit an eight-year-old boy while he was playing Holi in Mumbai's Bandra, killing him, and later hit and injured three other persons, who were on a morning walk. He was apprehended by local residents and handed over to the police. The driver reportedly told police he had mistakenly hit the accelerator, instead of brakes.

281.title: Ukrainian ballet star Artyom Datsishin dies from Russian shelling injuries
281.article_body: Ukrainian ballet star Artyom Datsishin passed away on Thursday from wounds he suffered in Russian shelling weeks earlier. Datsishin was a principal dancer with the National Opera of Ukraine. Earlier, Ukrainian actress Oksana Shvets was killed in a Russian rocket attack on a residential building in Kyiv.

282.title: 13-year-old boy killed, 4 injured after car hits autorickshaw in Delhi
282.article_body: A 13-year-old boy was killed and four others were injured after a car hit an autorickshaw on the Barapullah flyover in Delhi on Friday, police said. The autorickshaw driver and four members of a family were injured in the accident, police added. One of the injured family members was declared brought dead to the AIIMS Trauma Centre.

283.title: Indian firms may replace Western pharma companies leaving Russian market: Russia
283.article_body: Indian firms may replace Western pharmaceutical companies leaving the Russian market over Ukraine war, Russian envoy to India Denis Alipov told the Rossiya 24 broadcaster. The newly appointed Russian envoy added that India is a "world pharmacy". Earlier this month, Alipov had said that Moscow welcomed the independent foreign policy of India amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

284.title: Fortunes of US oil tycoons jump 10% to $239 billion amid Russia-Ukraine war
284.article_body: The collective net worth of American oil and gas industrialists jumped nearly 10% to $239 billion since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. Harold Hamm, the Co-founder of Continental Resources, moved up 28 places on Bloomberg's list of world's 500 richest people with $18.6 billion fortune. Meanwhile, Freeport LNG's Founder Michael Smith entered the list for the very first time.

285.title: Biden, Xi discuss Russia-Ukraine conflict in 2-hour-long video call
285.article_body: US President Joe Biden and Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday discussed the Russia-Ukraine conflict for nearly two hours on a video call. Xi told Biden that conflicts and confrontations were in no-one's interests, according to a Chinese foreign ministry statement. The US has sought to deter China from providing military or economic assistance for Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

286.title: LeT module busted in J&K’s Pulwama, 6 alleged militants arrested
286.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir police on Friday arrested six alleged militants after busting a module of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) in Pulwama district. "Preliminary probe revealed they were involved in providing logistics, shelter and motivating youth to act as hybrid terrorists," police said. The investigating team also learnt they were working for Reyaz Ahmad Dar alias Sheeraz of LeT, a spokesman said.

287.title: Partially eaten body of missing man found in jungles of UP's Kanpur
287.article_body: A 32-year-old labourer who went missing after leaving home for work on Wednesday has been found dead in jungles of Nirala Nagar railway ground in UP's Kanpur, with his body partially eaten by animals. The police also recovered a blood-stained brick along with a pair of slippers and handkerchief from near the body. His body has been sent for post-mortem.

288.title: Russia & Canada argue on Twitter over 'kindergarten-level' UN letter edits
288.article_body: A Russian envoy engaged in an argument with the Canadian mission to the United Nations, after the latter made several changes to a letter sent by Russia on providing aid access and civilian protection in Ukraine amid the war. Reacting to it, the Russian envoy said, "Thank you...for this kindergarten-level Russophobic libel!...It...shows that your...good manners are at lowest ebb."

289.title: 900 trees likely to be cut to widen 5 km road in MP's Indore
289.article_body: Around 900 trees have been identified for felling to facilitate the widening of a 5 km stretch on road in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, civic official Chetan Patil said, adding that only 10% of the trees would be transplanted. Trees such as neem and peepal would be uprooted by machines and transplanted using a special technique, he further said.

290.title: Presence of anthrax found in dead deer at IIT Madras campus
290.article_body: At least four deer deaths were recorded in IIT Madras campus in the last two days with testing "revealing the presence of anthrax" in one case, the institute said. According to National Health Portal, anthrax is an infectious zoonotic disease, meaning it can spread from animals to humans. Wildlife personnel who handled carcass will be administered antibiotics, the institute added.

291.title: High energy costs amid Ukraine conflict trigger protests in Europe
291.article_body: High energy costs due to Russia-Ukraine conflict have led to protests by farmers in France and Greece, while truckers in Spain have gone on strike. Notably, a substantial part of the oil and natural gas supply to Europe comes from Russia. Reportedly, the war worsened an energy supply crunch that has driven up costs for households and businesses for months.

292.title: Federer to donate $500,000 to support Ukrainian children’s education
292.article_body: Roger Federer on Friday said he will donate $500,000 through his foundation "to establish access to continued schooling for Ukrainian children" affected by Russia's invasion. "My family and I are horrified seeing pictures from Ukraine and heartbroken for the innocent people who have been so terribly affected. We stand for peace," he said. Federer is a 20-time Grand Slam champion.

293.title: Russian, Belarusian athletes banned from Diamond League
293.article_body: Premier track and field competition Diamond League has excluded Russian Authorised Neutral Athletes (ANA) and Belarusian athletes from its events "for the foreseeable future", organisers said. The decision has been taken following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "The Wanda Diamond League meetings accepted the recommendation of the board to exclude the respective athletes," organisers said.

294.title: He’s my idol since I was a kid: 18-year-old Alcaraz on Rafael Nadal
294.article_body: World number 19 Carlos Alcaraz on Saturday will play against his idol Rafael Nadal in the semi-finals of the BNP Paribas Open in Indian Wells. The 18-year-old beat defending champion Cameron Norrie 6-4, 6-3 to reach the semi-finals. "It's amazing to play against Rafa," Alcaraz said. "I think it's going to be a great match," he added.

295.title: Practised against tape-ball: Rizwan on preparations before Karachi Test
295.article_body: Muhammad Rizwan, who scored 104* in fourth innings of drawn second Pakistan-Australia Test, revealed how he prepared with "different drills" before Karachi Test. "I asked Iftikhar Ahmed in...nets to use tape-ball and bowl from angles like Pat Cummins did. Then...asked Zahid Mahmood [leg-spinner] to bowl to me in...rough area around...crease where we'd made marks from our spikes," he added.

296.title: BJP fields Agnimitra Paul against Shatrughan Sinha for Asansol by-poll
296.article_body: The BJP has fielded fashion designer-turned-politician Agnimitra Paul against TMC candidate Shatrughan Sinha for the Lok Sabha by-election from Asansol constituency. Similarly, the party has fielded Keya Ghosh against ex-Union Minister Babul Supriyo, who has been given a ticket by the TMC, for the by-election from Ballygunge seat. The by-polls for the two seats will be held on April 12.

297.title: Decision to quit BJP prompted by politics of hatred: Babul Supriyo
297.article_body: TMC leader Babul Supriyo, who quit BJP last year, said the decision was prompted by politics of "hatred and divisiveness" practised by its members. He further said he couldn't accept BJP leadership's "refusal to acknowledge...good work of a Bengali". BJP national secretary Anupam Hazra responded saying it's "ironical he didn't discover these traits and vices" when he was a minister.

298.title: Stop spreading threats against Russians on YouTube: Russia tells Google
298.article_body: Russian media regulator Roskomnadzor on Friday urged Google to stop spreading "anti-Russian" content on YouTube. "The actions of YouTube's administration are of a terrorist nature and threaten the life and health of Russian citizens," it said. Earlier this week, Russia blocked Instagram after its parent firm Meta allowed Ukrainian users to post messages such as "Death to the Russian invaders".

299.title: Google Maps down for several users globally, reason unknown
299.article_body: Google Maps went down for several users globally. According to Down Detector, the issues with the service started at around 9.15 pm IST. Several users complained their maps aren't loading, while others said they're getting a message reading 'Map's can't reach the internet'. In India, several users from Delhi, Ahmedabad, Kolkata, Mumbai and Hyderabad reported issues, as per Down Detector.

300.title: German parliament approves new law to lift most COVID-19 restrictions
300.article_body: Germany's parliament, known as the Bundestag, on Friday approved a new law in a 388-277 vote that lifted most COVID-19 restrictions. Health Minister Karl Lauterbach said the new Infection Protection Act was a "difficult compromise". Germany's Robert Koch Institute on Friday reported 2,97,841 new COVID-19 cases. Wearing of masks is no longer required in schools, shops or restaurants.

301.title: We're not here to prove anything: Hardik on GT's approach ahead of IPL
301.article_body: Talking about Gujarat Titans' approach ahead of upcoming IPL 2022, skipper Hardik Pandya said they are not in the tournament to "prove anything". He added, "We're here to make sure that the environment is right for...players to flourish in their own capacity." New franchise GT will begin their IPL campaign against fellow tournament debutants Lucknow Super Giants on March 28.

302.title: COVID-19 pandemic is far from over: WHO
302.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has stated that COVID-19 pandemic is far from over. "We are definitely in the middle of the coronavirus pandemic," WHO spokesperson Dr Margaret Harris said. After more than a month of decline, COVID-19 cases have started to increase around the world last week, the WHO said.

303.title: Russian oligarch's superyacht stuck in Norway as no one is selling it fuel
303.article_body: A superyacht owned by a Russian oligarch is stuck in a Norwegian port because no one is willing to sell it fuel in protest of the Ukraine war. The Ragnar is valued at $85 million and is owned by Vladimir Strzhalkovsky. Meanwhile, the yacht’s captain said that none of the crew is Russian and that such discrimination is "extremely unjust".

304.title: Over 18,000 Ukrainians granted EU citizenship in 2020: Eurostat
304.article_body: The European Union's (EU) statistics office Eurostat on Friday said around 18,100 Ukrainians were granted citizenship of EU countries in 2020, mainly by Poland and Germany. Eurostat data showed over 7,29,000 foreign nationals were granted citizenship by the EU's 27 member states. Ukrainians made up 3% of new citizens in 2020. Poland naturalised about 3,900 Ukrainians, most in the EU.

305.title: Man rapes Dutch woman in Jaipur after she calls him for Ayurvedic body massage
305.article_body: A man raped a 31-year-old Dutch woman after she called him for Ayurvedic body massage at a hotel in Jaipur. Police have arrested the accused named Biju Murlidharan, who was living in a rented accommodation in the Khatipura area of the city. "A medical examination of the woman has also been done and the accused is being interrogated," police said.

306.title: I've heard there's no coach like him: DC's Mandeep on head coach Ponting
306.article_body: Praising Ricky Ponting, DC batter Mandeep Singh said he's keenly looking forward to working with head coach of the franchise, adding he's heard people say that there's no coach like him. "He's one of the legends of the game...he's someone who maintains a healthy team atmosphere," he added. Mandeep was bought by DC for ₹1.1 crore in 2022 mega auction.

307.title: 1 BSF jawan dead, another missing as vehicle falls into water in Assam
307.article_body: One BSF personnel died after the vehicle he was travelling in with four others plunged into a water body in Assam's South Salmara Mankachar district along the Indo-Bangladesh border. Three personnel were rescued, however, a search operation is underway for the driver, who is missing. "It's suspected that the driver of the vehicle had lost control," a senior officer said.

308.title: I would love to see the now version of 'Friends': Lisa Kudrow
308.article_body: Actress Lisa Kudrow, who portrayed Phoebe Buffay on 'Friends', has said that she'd love to see a reboot of the series with an all-new cast and what the "now version" of it would be. Lisa and Jennifer Aniston, David Schwimmer, Matt Leblanc, Courteney Cox and Matthew Perry had earlier come together for a reunion episode which aired in May 2021.

309.title: Lakshya Sen, Gayatri Gopichand-Treesa Jolly enter All England semis
309.article_body: World Championships bronze medallist Lakshya Sen entered men's singles semi-finals of All England Championships after his opponent Lu Guang Zu of China gave a walkover on Friday. Ex-champion Pullela Gopichand's daughter Gayatri along with her partner Treesa Jolly saved two match points to reach women's doubles semi-finals after beating second seeds Lee Sohee and Shin Seungchan 14-21, 22-20, 21-15.

310.title: What are the 'Kamikaze' Switchblade drones that US is sending to Ukraine?
310.article_body: The 'Kamikaze drones' or the Switchblade drones are equipped with cameras, guidance systems and explosives, and can be carried in a backpack. The 'Kamikaze drones' are capable of circling above a target until the moment they can strike it with precision. The 'Kamikaze' attacks were a Japanese suicide bombing tactic deployed to attack enemy warships during World War II.

311.title: Food supply chains falling apart in Ukraine: World Food Programme
311.article_body: Food supply chains in Ukraine are "falling apart" due to the conflict with Russia, a World Food Programme (WFP) official said. "Movements of goods have slowed down due to insecurity and...reluctance of drivers," the official added. Key infrastructure such as bridges and trains have been destroyed by bombs and many grocery stores and warehouses are empty, according to Reuters.

312.title: I don't know how to live: Russian oligarch after being sanctioned by EU, UK
312.article_body: A Russian oligarch revealed that he doesn’t know how to live, days after he was sanctioned by the European Union and the UK. Mikhail Fridman, whose net worth was $14 billion before the war, is now worth around $10 billion. Fridman, a co-founder of the London investment firm LetterOne, added, "I don't understand the logic behind punishing me."

313.title: Best way to get a seat at the table is to pull up a chair: Indra Nooyi
313.article_body: PepsiCo's former CEO Indra Nooyi said the best way to get a seat at the table is to pull up a chair. In a video posted on LinkedIn, she added, "Don't wait to be invited because the invitation may never come. Actively seek out opportunities to participate and take every opportunity you can to share your talent and unique perspective."

314.title: Director Girish Malik's 17-year-old son passes away after falling from 5th floor
314.article_body: Director-producer Girish Malik's 17-year-old son Mannan passed away after falling from the fifth floor of his building in Mumbai's Andheri on Friday. Mannan was rushed to Kokilaben Ambani Hospital but he did not survive, ETimes reported. The incident happened after 5 pm when he returned to his home after celebrating Holi.

315.title: Which countries are seeing a spike in COVID-19 cases?
315.article_body: Several countries have reported a spike in COVID-19 cases in last few days. South Korea reported record more than 6,21,000 infections on Thursday. Italy reported 79,895 coronavirus cases on Thursday. In UK, the number of COVID-19 patients in hospital increased from 8,210 on March 3 to 11,346 on March 17. Germany reported 294,931 new cases in the past 24 hours.

316.title: Hundreds still trapped under theatre bombed by Russia: Ukraine
316.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that rescue work was ongoing to save hundreds of people still believed to be trapped under the rubble of a bombed theatre in Mariupol city. "There is only this information: 130 people are alive and have been taken out. The rest are waiting for help," an official said. The theatre was bombed by Russia.

317.title: No explanation: Smriti on India's inconsistent batting in Women's WC
317.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana said there's "no explanation" for the team's inconsistent batting performances in ongoing 2022 Women's World Cup. "Well, if I had an explanation, I would've definitely discussed [it] in...team dressing room," she added. Smriti further said the team's batting unit together hasn't clicked in the tournament so far. India are currently fourth in standings.

318.title: Team helped me stand on my feet again after I lost my father: Vandana
318.article_body: Speaking about a major turning point in her life after her father passed away in April 2021, Indian women's hockey team forward Vandana Katariya said, "The support I received from my teammates...(head coach) Janneke Schopman helped me stand on my feet again." Notably, Vandana became the first Indian woman hockey player ever to score a hat-trick at Olympics in Tokyo.

319.title: Not interested right now: Daniel on reprising Harry Potter role
319.article_body: Actor Daniel Radcliffe has stated that he's not really interested in reprising his role of Harry Potter right now. Chris Columbus had said he wants to cast the original trio in the film adaptation of 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child'. "I feel like I made it out of Potter okay and I'm...happy with where I am now," Daniel added.

320.title: West Indies' Shamilia collapses on field during Women's World Cup match
320.article_body: West Indies pacer Shamilia Connell collapsed on the field during 47th over of Bangladesh's innings in a Women's World Cup match. The medical staff attended to her before taking her off the ground. She was then taken to a hospital in an ambulance. "She's a strong girl and we're backing her to get well soon," her teammate Hayley Matthews said.

321.title: NZ couple's Guinness World Record application for 'world's largest potato' rejected
321.article_body: Guinness World Records has rejected an application by a New Zealand couple, who believed they had dug up the world's largest potato weighing 7.9 kg. "Sadly the specimen is not a potato and is in fact the tuber of a type of gourd," Guinness World Records told the couple in an email following months of submitting photos and paperwork.

322.title: Pic shows 109 empty prams in Ukrainian city to honour children killed in ongoing war
322.article_body: As many as 109 empty prams were placed on the Rynok Square in Ukraine's Lviv in honour of children killed in the war against Russia. "Thatʼs the number of Ukrainian children mercilessly killed by Russian troops since the beginning of the full-scale war," Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs tweeted while sharing a picture.

323.title: OTT allows artistes, storytellers to explore global stories: Madhuri
323.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit in an interview has stated that OTT platforms allow artistes and storytellers to explore global stories. "In the medium of OTT, you can be a first-time director but you can show a story in your own language or shoot it the way you want to," the actress added. Madhuri further said that OTT offers flexibility with subjects.

324.title: Adani Group exploring buying a stake in oil giant Saudi Aramco: Report
324.article_body: Adani Group is exploring the possibility of buying a stake in oil gaint Saudi Aramco, Bloomberg reported. Billionaire Gautam Adani-led conglomerate has held preliminary talks on a range of potential cooperation and joint investment opportunities with Aramco and Public Investment Fund (PIF), the report said. Adani may offer PIF the opportunity to invest in infrastructure in India, it added.

325.title: Govt land worth ₹150 cr freed from encroachers in Madhya Pradesh
325.article_body: More than 100 hectares of government land worth over ₹150 crore were freed from encroachers in Madhya Pradesh's Orchha, the Niwari district Collector said. An order has been issued retaking possession of these land parcels, which were usurped using fraudulent means, he added. This includes land given to tribals on lease by the government free of cost, he further said.

326.title: Dhoni's wicket best moment in IPL 2021, want to dismiss Kohli now: Sakariya
326.article_body: DC pacer Chetan Sakariya has said picking CSK captain MS Dhoni's wicket was the best moment for him from IPL 2021. "Virat [Kohli] bhai is...one batsman I'd like to dismiss in IPL 2022," he added. Sakariya, who played his debut season of IPL for RR in 2021, was bought by DC for ₹4.2 crore at IPL mega auction last month.

327.title: Tokyo Olympics gold has motivated me to do even better: Neeraj Chopra
327.article_body: Neeraj Chopra said the javelin gold medal he won at Tokyo Olympics has motivated him to do "even better" in life. He added he wants to win his first-ever World Championships medal and defend his Commonwealth Games and Asian Games gold medals this year. He's been nominated in 2022 Laureus World Sports Awards in 'World Breakthrough of the Year' category.

328.title: Dalai Lama makes 1st public appearance after more than 2 years
328.article_body: Dalai Lama on Friday made his first public appearance in over two years after his offline engagements were cancelled due to COVID-19. While addressing a gathering in Dharamshala, Dalai Lama said he's in "good health and can even play boxing with the doctor". "This is a very beautiful day and we're getting to see his Holiness," an audience member said.

329.title: Everton’s Iwobi scores 99th minute winner to beat Newcastle 1-0 in PL
329.article_body: Everton's Alex Iwobi on Thursday scored in the ninth minute of stoppage time to help Everton beat Newcastle United 1-0 in the Premier League. The match was delayed at the start of the second-half after a pitch invader tied himself to a goalpost. The win helped Everton move three points above the relegation zone in 17th place with 25 points.

330.title: West Ham beat Sevilla 2-0, Barcelona beat Galatasaray 2-1 in Europa League
330.article_body: West Ham United on Thursday beat Sevilla 2-0, while Barcelona beat Galatasaray 2-1 in their respective Europa League last-16 second-leg ties to reach the quarter-finals. Ukrainian international Andriy Yarmolenko scored in extra-time to win the game for West Ham. Goals by Pedri and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang helped Barcelona win 2-1 after the Turkish side took the lead in the 28th minute.

331.title: Body of 21-yr-old Indian student killed in Ukraine to reach Bengaluru on Mar 20
331.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday said the mortal remains of Indian student Naveen Shekharappa Gyanagoudar, who was killed during shelling in Ukraine on March 1, will arrive in Bengaluru on March 20. The 21-year-old student, a resident of Karnataka's Haveri district, was standing in a  queue at a supermarket in Kharkiv when he was killed in the shelling.

332.title: Perverse abuse of power: Pope Francis on Russia’s invasion of Ukraine
332.article_body: Pope Francis on Friday condemned Russia's invasion of Ukraine, calling it a "perverse abuse of power". Russia began its invasion of neighbouring Ukraine on February 24. "Once more humanity is threatened by a perverse abuse of power and partisan interests which condemns defenceless people to suffer every form of brutal violence," he said.

333.title: Red Bulls’ Perez calls for drivers to be allowed to race with COVID-19
333.article_body: Red Bull's Sergio Perez believes Formula One drivers should be allowed to race if they test positive for COVID-19. "There's so much we've learned about the virus that going forward we should discuss whether we allow the drivers to race if the symptoms are mild," he said. Aston Martin's Sebastian Vettel will miss the Bahrain Grand Prix after testing positive.

334.title: How has India ranked in World Happiness Report over the years?
334.article_body: In the 2022 World Happiness Report, India ranked 136th among 146 countries, while in 2021, it had ranked 139th among 149 countries. In 2020, India's rank was 144th, while in 2019, India was ranked 140th. In the 2018 report, it ranked 133rd and in 2017, it ranked 122nd. India was ranked 118th out of 157 countries in the 2016 report.

335.title: 'Spider-Man', 'WandaVision' win at Critics Choice Super Awards 2022
335.article_body: Marvel's 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' and 'WandaVision' were awarded Best Superhero Movie and Best Superhero Series respectively at the Critics Choice Super Awards 2022. Actor Andrew Garfield won Best Actor in a Superhero Movie for his role in 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'. Actress Florence Pugh was awarded Best Actress in a Superhero Movie for 'Black Widow'.

336.title: I'm still the girl who started 10 yrs ago, haven't mastered everything: Alia
336.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that she is still the young girl who started in the film industry 10 years ago, adding she doesn't think she has mastered everything. The actress added that she will continue to learn and grow only if she doubts herself. "Being grounded is all about not believing in one's own success or failure," Alia said.

337.title: Lia Thomas becomes first transgender woman to win NCAA swimming title
337.article_body: Lia Thomas on Thursday became the first transgender woman to win an NCAA swimming title after winning the women's 500-yard freestyle. The University of Pennsylvania swimmer won with a time of four minutes and 33.24 seconds. Thomas competed on the men's team for three years before moving to the women's team. "It means the world to be here," Thomas said.

338.title: Russian soldiers shooting themselves in the legs to avoid fighting: Reports
338.article_body: Some Russian soldiers have been shooting themselves in the legs using Ukrainian ammunition to appear as if they were hit by the defenders and escape fighting. In a leaked audio clip between soldiers, one Russian said, "They’ve been shooting at us for 14 days. We’re scared. We’re stealing food, breaking into houses. We’re killing civilians."

339.title: Lives being sacrificed for senseless war: Arnold on Russia-Ukraine war
339.article_body: Actor-politician Arnold Schwarzenegger shared a video for Russian soldiers amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, saying, "Your lives, your limbs and your futures are being sacrificed for a senseless war condemned by the entire world." Arnold further said Russian government lied to its citizens and soldiers. "Russia, because of its brutality, is now isolated from the society of nations," he said.

340.title: Very important: Mandhana ahead of India vs Australia in Women's WC
340.article_body: Opener Smriti Mandhana, who is India's top-scorer in 2022 Women's World Cup so far, said match against Australia on Saturday is "very important", adding she hopes to contribute in it. "Everyone knows what happened in 2017 but...it's going to be a fresh day [tomorrow]," she added. Five years ago, India beat Australia by 36 runs to enter World Cup final.

341.title: PMC committees to operate under Administrator's leadership: Official
341.article_body: Various committees of the Pune Municipal Corporation will continue to function under the leadership of the Administrator after the five-year term of PMC's elected body ended on March 14, the Municipal Secretary said. PMC Commissioner Vikram Kumar was appointed as the Administrator of the civic body. Kumar will decide on proposals submitted to the committees, the Secretary added.

342.title: Cyclist dies after boy aims water filled balloon at scooter in Maha
342.article_body: A 54-year-old cyclist died in the Virar area of Maharashtra's Palghar district after being hit by a scooter whose driver lost control as a result of being hit by a water-filled balloon. The balloon was allegedly thrown by a boy travelling on a truck. The deceased, Ramchandra Patel, died on the spot, police said, adding, a probe is underway.

343.title: Priyanka Chopra sells her Rolls-Royce Ghost to a Bengaluru-based businessman
343.article_body: Priyanka Chopra has sold her Rolls-Royce Ghost she had bought in 2013 to a Bengaluru-based businessman. While the price at which the actress sold her car isn't known yet, the base price of the car when she bought was ₹4.5 crore. Priyanka reportedly sold the car as it was not being used frequently with her having shifted base to US.

344.title: 3 injured after tempo and car collide on Mumbai's Hindmata bridge
344.article_body: Three people were injured following a collision between a tempo and a car at Mumbai's Hindmata bridge on Friday morning. No casualties were reported in the incident and the injured have been admitted to KEM Hospital. According to reports, the incident led to a huge traffic jam with queues on the bridge for about 2 kilometres.

345.title: Catholic cross vandalised at Mumbai's Vile Parle
345.article_body: Representatives of the Catholic East Indian community in Mumbai have made a representation to the police and CM after a catholic cross in Vile Parle was allegedly vandalised last week. The representation stated that a "definitive pattern" is seen in such incidents, adding, they are done with "deliberate intentions of hurting the religious sentiments of the Christian Community".

346.title: Pic shows word 'children' written around Ukrainian theatre before powerful bomb hit it
346.article_body: A satellite image has surfaced online showing a closer view of the Mariupol Drama Theatre before it was hit by a powerful bomb. In the picture, word "children" in Russian can be seen written in large white letters around the theatre. Around 1,000 and 1,200 people had sought refuge in the building, as per Mariupol's Deputy Mayor Sergei Orlov.

347.title: I personally chased BYJU'S CEO for our 1st meeting in 2016: Unacademy CEO
347.article_body: Unacademy's Co-founder and CEO Gaurav Munjal revealed that he personally chased Byju Raveendran, the Co-founder and CEO of rival edtech startup BYJU'S, for their first meeting in 2016 when Munjal was "a young edtech entrepreneur". Munjal told Moneycontrol, "The reference I've always made is that I want Unacademy to beat BYJU'S and become the no. 1 edtech company in India."
