348.title: Jaya Bachchan gets angry at photographers, video surfaces
348.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing veteran actress Jaya Bachchan getting angry at photographers clicking her pictures. In the video, Jaya can be seen sitting inside a car and talking to someone. As paparazzi came near her car, she looked at them in anger and made a hand gesture. "Why does she give such reaction every time," a user commented.

349.title: Quess Corp Founder donates ₹105 cr to IISc to set up centre for public health
349.article_body: Quess Corp Founder Ajit Isaac and his wife Sarah have committed ₹105 crore to establish a Centre for Public Health at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bengaluru. The centre will be a part of the postgraduate medical school and it will be operational by 2024. Earlier, Mindtree Co-founders donated ₹425 crore to IISc to establish the medical school.

350.title: Which are the bottom 10 countries on the World Happiness Report?
350.article_body: The United Nations’ World Happiness Report has ranked Finland to be the world’s happiest country in the world, for the fifth consecutive year while Afghanistan was named as the unhappiest country. The 10 countries at the bottom of the list included Zambia at 137th rank, followed by Malawi, Tanzania, Sierra Leone, Lesotho, Botswana, Rwanda, Zimbabwe, Lebanon and Afghanistan.

351.title: I played Akshay's mother in 'Waqt' because I wanted to: Shefali Shah
351.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has said that she played Akshay Kumar's mother and Amitabh Bachchan's wife in 2005 film 'Waqt: The Race Against Time' because she wanted to. She added that husband Vipul Amrutlal Shah didn't want her to do it but it was her choice. Shefali is five years younger than Akshay and was 28 when she did the film.

352.title: German Chancellor Scholz defends removing most COVID-19 restrictions
352.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Thursday defended his government's plan to remove almost all COVID-19 restrictions in the country on March 20. "We are entering a new phase of the pandemic, in which we, like nearly all our neighbouring countries, will be getting rid of nearly all protective measures," he said. Masks will be required on public transportation and hospitals.

353.title: Assam startup names tea blend after Ukrainian Prez to honour his courage
353.article_body: An Assam-based startup has launched a new brew of a "strong Assam tea" named after Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to "honour his valour and courage" amid the Russian invasion. Aromatic Tea's Director Ranjit Baruah, said, "There’s nothing stronger than him at the moment in the world...I was trying to draw an analogy that this tea is as strong as Zelenskyy."

354.title: Nuis becomes 1st speed skater in history to clock 100 kmph, video goes viral
354.article_body: Dutch speed skater Kjeld Nuis broke the world record by clocking 103 kmph over natural ice on Norway’s Savalen Lake. The 32-year-old three-time Olympic champion exceeded the 100 kmph mark as he added a further 10 kmph to his existing speed record. He said, "I was literally flying over the ice...This is really the maximum that is possible on skates."

355.title: 'The Kashmir Files' earns over ₹100 crore worldwide in 7 days
355.article_body: Vivek Agnihotri-directorial 'The Kashmir Files' has surpassed ₹100-crore earnings worldwide in seven days of the film's release. Actor Anupam Kher took to Instagram to reveal that the film has earned ₹106.80 crore in seven days, writing, "Our film 'The Kashmir Files' is showing its true colours! Happy Holi to all!"

356.title: Big B shares pic with Jaya on Holi, granddaughter Navya photobombs
356.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan on Thursday took to Instagram to share a picture with his wife actress-politician Jaya Bachchan celebrating Holi. The actor can be seen applying tika to Jaya on her forehead and a glimpse of their granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda can be seen in the background. Their daughter Shweta Bachchan commented on the photo, "How cute. Happy Holi."

357.title: Bhagavad Gita is for all, not only for Hindus: Karnataka Edu Min
357.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh has said that the holy book of Bhagavad Gita "is not only for Hindus, but for all". His statement comes after the Gujarat government has decided to introduce the Bhagavad Gita in the school syllabus for classes 6-12. He further said that "if experts say, it will definitely be introduced" in Karnataka as well.

358.title: He's irritable & forgetful: Russia as Biden calls Putin 'murderous dictator'
358.article_body: Russia said US President Joe Biden's comments about President Vladimir Putin are "personal insults". Biden had called Putin a "war criminal" and a "murderous dictator". "Given such irritability from Biden, his fatigue and sometimes forgetfulness...fatigue that leads to aggressive statements, we'll not make harsh assessments so as not to cause more aggression," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said.

359.title: I can make a film with Shah Rukh Khan in my sleep: Farah Khan
359.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan has said that she can make a film with actor Shah Rukh Khan in her sleep. She added that when the timing is right, it will fall into place. Shah Rukh has worked in Farah's 'Main Hoon Na', 'Om Shanti Om' and 'Happy New Year'. She further said that her films should get mass acclaim.

360.title: Poland to propose peacekeeping mission for Ukraine at NATO summit: PM
360.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki on Friday said that Poland will formally submit a proposal for a peacekeeping mission in Ukraine at the next NATO summit. Notably, Morawiecki and the Prime Ministers of Slovenia and the Czech Republic had recently visited the Ukrainian capital Kyiv despite the ongoing war. Several NATO nations have provided military aid to Ukraine amid the conflict.

361.title: Don't politicise legitimate energy transactions: Govt sources
361.article_body: India's legitimate energy transactions should not be politicised and countries that are either self-sufficient in oil or are importing from Russia cannot credibly advocate restrictive trading, government sources said. The remarks come amid reports of India purchasing discounted crude oil from Russia, which is facing international sanctions over its invasion of Ukraine.

362.title: I call him Pammi aunty: Pooja Hegde on 'Cirkus' co-star Ranveer Singh
362.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde opened up about sharing screen space with Ranveer Singh in the upcoming comedy film 'Cirkus' and said, "He is like full entertainment." "I call him Pammi aunty. He's just too much fun to be around, and he's so observant of everybody," she added. "We make a great onscreen pair also," Pooja further said.

363.title: World C'ships silver-medallist Kidambi loses in 2nd round of All England
363.article_body: Indian shuttler Kidambi Srikanth lost in second round of men's singles at All England Championships in Birmingham. Fifth-seeded Anthony Sinisuka Ginting beat the World Championships silver-medallist 9-21, 21-18, 21-19. Meanwhile, the Indian duo of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty entered men's doubles quarter-finals after defeating Germany's Mark Lamsfuss and Marvin Seidel 21-7, 21-7.

364.title: Nation celebrating Holi, Shab-e-Barat on same day, this is beauty of India: Naqvi
364.article_body: As the country celebrates Holi and Shab-e-Barat on Friday, Union Minister for Minority Affairs Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi said that this is the beauty of our country that the people celebrate all festivals. "This is Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat," Naqvi added. "Holi is the symbol of social unity, communal harmony and brotherhood," Naqvi wrote while sharing pictures on Twitter.

365.title: No player has hit a Test ton faster than Shikhar Dhawan on debut
365.article_body: Batter Shikhar Dhawan smashed the fastest hundred on a Test debut off 85 balls against Australia in the Mohali Test that ended on March 18, 2013. Dhawan overtook West Indies' Dwayne Smith, who slammed Test ton on debut off 93 balls against South Africa in 2004. Dhawan is among the 16 Indians who have hit a century on Test debut.

366.title: 98-yr-old Ukrainian woman who fought World War II offers to fight Russia, govt shares pic
366.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs took to Twitter to share a picture of 98-year-old Olha Tverdokhlibova, who offered to fight for Ukraine against Russia. Olha is a World War II veteran, the ministry stated. "Despite all the merits and experience was denied, though, because of age. We are sure, she will celebrate another victory soon in Kyiv!" it further wrote.

367.title: Norway preparing to host 1 lakh refugees amid conflict in Ukraine: PM
367.article_body: Norwegian PM Jonas Gahr Støre on Friday announced that Norway is preparing to host up to 1 lakh people fleeing the conflict in Ukraine. Norway expects to receive around 30,000 refugees from Ukraine this year, he said. Around 2,000 refugees have arrived in Norway so far and the Norwegian government said that it'll soon receive an additional 5,250 people.

368.title: 1 killed, 4 injured after parts of Russian missile fall on building in Ukraine
368.article_body: One person was killed and four others were injured after parts of a Russian missile fell on a residential building in Ukraine's capital Kyiv on Friday, emergencies services said. Twelve people were rescued and 98 people were evacuated from the five-storey building, the services added. Over 700 people have been killed in Ukraine since Russia's attack, the United Nations said.

369.title: Which are the world's top 10 happiest countries as India in bottom 11?
369.article_body: According to the UN-sponsored World Happiness Report, Finland has been ranked the happiest country in the world, followed by Denmark, Iceland, Switzerland, Netherlands and Luxembourg. Sweden has been ranked seven. Other countries in the top 10 are Norway, Israel and New Zealand. India has been ranked 136 among 146 countries, and Afghanistan has been ranked as the least happiest country.

370.title: Actor Vishal feeds over 200 elderly people on Puneeth's birth anniversary
370.article_body: On late Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar's birth anniversary on Thursday, Vishal served food to more than 200 elderly people across various old age shelters in and around Chennai. The actor, who predominantly works in the Tamil film industry, shared a video on Twitter, writing, "Nothing else would make my friend Puneeth more happy...on his birthday than helping these lovely ones."

371.title: Smeared in colours, CRPF jawans celebrate Holi in Srinagar
371.article_body: The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel celebrated Holi in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Friday. They smeared colours on each other and danced to Holi songs to celebrate the festival. "We are enjoying the festival. Even if we are away from our family members but the personnel are also part of our family," a jawan said.

372.title: Samoa reports its first unexplained COVID-19 case in community, goes into lockdown
372.article_body: The Pacific island nation of Samoa has sealed its borders as it entered a nationwide lockdown after recording its first unexplained case of COVID-19 in the community. The case was detected in a 29-year-old on the main island of Upolu. A government report leaked online indicated the woman had taken part in church services, and visited places including a hospital.

373.title: Want to shut all 800 restaurants but our Russian partner refused: Burger King owner
373.article_body: Restaurant Brands International, the parent company of Burger King, said it wants to immediately shut all its 800 restaurants in Russia but its Russian joint venture partner has "refused" to do so.  "We can't unilaterally suspend operations" because it's a "complicated legal process", it added. Earlier, the company suspended corporate support for Russian locations amid Ukraine's invasion.

374.title: Britney Spears deletes Instagram account again, fans express concern
374.article_body: Singer Britney Spears' Instagram account was deactivated once again on Wednesday afternoon, following which many of her fans took to social media to express concern. One fan wrote, "Seems like something is going on, we'll see," while another tweeted, "Me right now panicking #BritneySpears." ET Online has reported that the singer is taking "a well-deserved break as many celebrities do".

375.title: Wrestler Sangram Singh announces wedding with Payal Rohatgi in July
375.article_body: Wrestler Sangram Singh on Thursday announced his upcoming wedding with longtime girlfriend actress Payal Rohatgi in July. Sangram tweeted that their wedding was scheduled for March but was postponed amid work commitments. This comes after Payal broke down on reality show 'Lock Upp', saying it has been 12 years since she's been dating Sangram and she wants to get married.

376.title: Fake doctor cheats Pune woman of ₹22 lakh; met her on matrimonial site
376.article_body: A woman in Pune was duped of ₹22 lakh by fraudsters who posed as a doctor on a matrimonial website. She allegedly transferred the amount to them on pretexts like air travel expenditure, gold tax, etc. over a period of eight months. She filed a complaint with the police after realising that the person she met online does not exist.

377.title: Devotees throng at Vrindavan’s Banke Bihari temple to celebrate Holi
377.article_body: With sweets and colours in their hands, devotees gathered in huge numbers at Vrindavan's Banke Bihari temple to celebrate Holi on Friday. They were seen standing in queues to get a glimpse of their deity, Krishna at the temple. They also threw colours on the devotees gathered at the temple. Vrindavan holds a historic significance for the festival of Holi.

378.title: Godzilla actor Akira Takarada dies aged 87
378.article_body: Japanese actor Akira Takarada, known for his role in the original Godzilla, has died at the age of 87. Takarada's death was announced by Toho Studios, the production company responsible for the 1954 movie. In Godzilla, Takarada played Hideto Ogata, a sailor who works with the Japanese Coast Guard after Godzilla sinks a boat.

379.title: ₹2,000 cash found at unicorn founder's home after 3-day I-T raid on Infra.Market
379.article_body: The I-T department conducted a three-day raid at the offices of unicorn startup Infra.Market and the residences of Founders Souvik Sengupta and Aaditya Sharda. It found ₹2,000 in cash and jewellery worth ₹1.2 lakh at Sengupta's residence and cash and jewellery worth ₹20 lakh each at Sharda's residence. No unaccounted cash or assets were found at its offices, Moneycontrol reported.

380.title: About 300 ships carrying grain exports stopped by Russian forces
380.article_body: Russian forces have stopped around 300 ships carrying grain exports from leaving the Black Sea amid the ongoing war in Ukraine. The administrator of the Panamanian Maritime Authority Noriel Arauz said three Panamanian-flagged ships have been struck by Russian fire since the invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. Russia produces nearly 80 million metric tons of wheat per year.

381.title: 'The Kashmir Files' to be screened for Bihar MLAs, MLCs in Patna on Mar 25
381.article_body: The Bihar government is going to arrange a special screening of Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' for MLAs and MLCs of the state. The film will be screened in Patna at 6.30 pm on March 25. "The movie is based on the plight of Kashmiri Pandits...It needs to be watched by more and more people," Deputy CM Tarkishore Prasad said.

382.title: 'Skip Intro' button used 136 mn times a day, saves users’ 195 years: Netflix
382.article_body: In a blog post, Netflix has revealed that its 'Skip Intro' button is pressed about 136 million times each day, saving users across the world a cumulative time of 195 years. Explaining how the ‘Skip Intro’ feature was created five years ago, Netflix stated that 15% of the time customers were manually advancing the series within the first five minutes.

383.title: Japan announces further sanctions on Russian officials, arms exporter
383.article_body: Japan on Friday said it will impose sanctions against 15 Russian individuals and nine organisations including the state-owned arms exporter Rosoboronexport. Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Japan's finance ministry said Japan has sanctioned 76 individuals, seven banks and 12 organisations. "These sanctions hit at the heart of Russia's war machine," US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel said.

384.title: Court acquits 2 serving life imprisonment for double murder in Pune
384.article_body: Two men who were serving life imprisonment in connection with the murder of an elderly couple in the Pune district were acquitted by Bombay High Court on Thursday. The couple was murdered in 2009. The court said the trial court was not justified in arriving at the conclusion that the prosecution has proved its case beyond a reasonable doubt.

385.title: UK revokes Russian channel RT's licence amid probe into Ukraine war coverage
385.article_body: UK media regulator has revoked the licence of Russian-backed broadcaster RT amid probe into the impartiality of its coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We don't consider RT's licensee, ANO TV Novosti, fit and proper to hold...UK broadcast licence," the regulator, Ofcom, said. This move by Ofcom shows that "it's nothing more than a tool of government", RT said.

386.title: India celebrates Holi in Auckland ahead of Australia match in Women's WC
386.article_body: India, who are currently playing in 2022 Women's World Cup, celebrated Holi in Auckland before their next match against Australia on Saturday. BCCI Women posted a picture on Twitter and wrote, "Ringing in the festivities post practice in Auckland. Here's Team India wishing everyone a Happy Holi all the way from New Zealand." India have two wins from four matches.

387.title: Train services between India, Bangladesh likely to resume from March 26
387.article_body: The train services of Maitree Express and Bandhan Express between India and Bangladesh are likely to resume from March 26, said the Ministry of Railways on Thursday. The decision is subjected to the clearance of the Ministry of Home Affairs, the Railways added. The train services between the two countries were suspended in March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

388.title: NASA rolls out its mega Moon rocket for 1st time, shares pics
388.article_body: NASA has rolled out its mega Moon rocket for the first time. The vehicle, known as the Space Launch System (SLS), along with the Orion capsule atop, was taken to the pad at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida to conduct a dummy countdown. NASA is targeting May as the earliest window for Artemis-1, an uncrewed lunar mission.

389.title: Oil protestor ties himself by neck to goalpost during PL match, pic goes viral
389.article_body: Everton-Newcastle United Premier League match was held up for eight minutes on Thursday after a protestor tied himself to the goalpost at the Gwladys Street end of Goodison Park. The invader was wearing a jersey with the words 'Just Stop Oil'. "[UK] government must end all new fossil fuel supply projects," the group claiming responsibility for the stunt said.

390.title: Robert Pattinson's The Batman crosses $500 million at worldwide box office
390.article_body: Robert Pattinson-starrer 'The Batman' has earned over $500 million at the worldwide box office. The film, which was made on a budget of $200 million, earned over $258.3 million in the US and over $247 million in international markets, as per a report. "We congratulate...the entire cast and crew on this wonderful benchmark," Warner Bros Pictures chairman Toby Emmerich said.

391.title: TV actress among those rescued as prostitution racket busted in Goa
391.article_body: The Goa Crime Branch on Friday said it has arrested a Hyderabad-based man named Hafiz Syed Bilal and rescued three women, including a television actress, after busting a prostitution racket. Two of the rescued women, including the TV actress, are from Virar near Mumbai. "Information was received...and accordingly a trap was laid," the police said.

392.title: Jharkhand's mob lynching bill is not legal: BJP state President
392.article_body: Jharkhand BJP President Deepak Prakash has termed the state's 'Prevention of Mob Violence and Mob Lynching Bill, 2021' as "not legal" and a bill passed by the state assembly for "politics of appeasement". He backed the state Governor Ramesh Bais for returning the draft of the bill and also stated that the bill will "disrupt social harmony" in Jharkhand.

393.title: Narmada project participating states yet to pay ₹7,225 cr to Gujarat: CM
393.article_body: Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel said that Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra and Rajasthan, the three participating states of the Sardar Sarovar Narmada Yojana, are yet to give ₹7,225 crore to Gujarat. Madhya Pradesh has to pay ₹4,953.42 crore, Maharashtra ₹1,715.67 crore and Rajasthan ₹556 crore to Gujarat. In the past two years, Madhya Pradesh did not pay anything, Patel added.

394.title: Kim's boyfriend Pete Davidson won't be going to space on Blue Origin flight
394.article_body: American comedian Pete Davidson, who's currently dating socialite Kim Kardashian, will not be flying to space on Blue Origin's upcoming spaceflight, billionaire Jeff Bezos-led space tourism company said as it delayed the launch. The development comes days after Blue Origin announced Davidson would be one of the six passengers on its next spaceflight. It did not provide any further detail.

395.title: Taliban bans broadcast of all foreign TV shows in Afghanistan: Report
395.article_body: The Taliban has banned the broadcast of all foreign TV series in Afghanistan, as per a report. A participant at the meeting of Afghan broadcasters said, "The Taliban clearly said to stop showing any foreign TV series translated into Dari or Pashto [official languages of Afghanistan]." Report added that the authorities said they won't accept any excuses for violating this.

396.title: Diljit Dosanjh to portray singer Amar Singh Chamkila in his biopic: Reports
396.article_body: Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh has reportedly been roped in to play the role of Amar Singh Chamkila in an upcoming film based on the life of the late musician. The biopic will be directed by filmmaker Imtiaz Ali. Amar and his wife, Amarjot, were killed, along with two members of their band in March 1988 in an assassination which remains unresolved.

397.title: I'd give anything to see you smile 1 more time: Leone on mom's death anniversary
397.article_body: Taking to Instagram on Friday, Sunny Leone penned a note remembering her mother on her death anniversary. Sharing an old picture of herself with her parents, she wrote, "14 years ago today you left us but every day I miss you more...and would give anything to see you smile and call me Googu one more time. Love you Mumma!"

398.title: It's time to break away from societal stereotypes of wedding: Yami
398.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has said it's high time to break away from societal stereotypes for wedding ceremonies. She further said she'd have opted for a minimalist wedding even if it wasn't held during the pandemic. "I would have still worn my mother's sari, my grandmother's nath, dupatta and the aatheru (traditional Kashmiri ear ornament) given by my in-laws," Yami added.

399.title: Rare and deadly virus found in ticks in 6 US states: Study
399.article_body: Scientists have found a rare but potentially deadly Heartland virus in lone star ticks in Georgia. Its RNA has been detected in immature and mature ticks in Missouri, Alabama, Illinois, Kansas and New York so far. In 2009, two men were hospitalised with high fever, diarrhoea, muscle pain and symptoms similar to Lyme disease marking the virus' first case.

400.title: Andaman MP urges Lt Guv to put disaster machinery on high alert ahead of cyclone
400.article_body: Andaman and Nicobar Islands MP Kuldeep Rai Sharma has urged the Lieutenant Governor to put the islands' disaster management machinery on high alert after the IMD predicted Cyclone Asani over Bay of Bengal on March 21. Rai has also requested Lieutenant Governor Admiral (Retd) DK Joshi to declare a holiday in schools and colleges on March 19 and 21.

401.title: I played Calendar in Mr. India, then did that in 150 films: Satish
401.article_body: Actor Satish Kaushik has stated that he played Calendar in 1987 film 'Mr. India' and everyone thought that he can only make people laugh. "And I ended up doing that in 150 films!" the actor added. He further said that earlier an actor could get typecast very quickly, adding it was an "innocent age" with no exposure to world cinema.
